identification.text: Grandma Singletons Beacon Fell PDO Traditional Creamy Lancashire is a true gem of Lancashire, produced by the renowned cheese manufacturer Grandma Singletons. This cheese has a rich history and geographical provenance, as it is made using locally sourced milk from farms within a 12-mile radius.

slots.NameOfCheese: Grandma Singletons Beacon Fell PDO Traditional Creamy Lancashire

description.text: This award-winning cheese boasts a wonderfully creamy texture and a clean, zingy freshness that will awaken your taste buds. It has a round shape and a weight of approximately 200g. The texture is smooth and creamy, with a natural rind coating. This cheese is made from high-quality cow's milk and uses traditional rennet for its authentic taste.

process.text: Grandma Singletons Beacon Fell PDO Traditional Creamy Lancashire is handcrafted using time-honored traditional methods. The cheese is prepared with great care and aged to perfection, resulting in a cheese that is bursting with full Lancashire flavor.

smell_taste.text: Upon opening the package, you will be greeted with a delightful aroma that will entice your senses. The taste of this cheese is a crescendo of flavors, starting with a clean and zingy freshness, building up to a full Lancashire flavor. It is truly a special cheese that will leave a lasting impression.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, we recommend enjoying Grandma Singletons Beacon Fell PDO Traditional Creamy Lancashire at room temperature. This cheese is perfect for a creamy au gratin sauce, adding a smooth and full-flavored touch to any risotto. It also pairs beautifully with smoked haddock, adding a beautiful compliment to any dish. For a complete experience, we suggest serving this cheese with a crisp white wine.

slots.ServeWithDishList: au gratin sauce, risotto, smoked haddock

quality_assurance.text: At Grandma Singletons, we take pride in our cheese and ensure the highest quality standards. Our cheese has received numerous awards, including a PDO for its authentic taste. We also use only locally sourced milk from trusted farms, ensuring the best quality and taste in every bite. As our founder, Grandma Singleton, used to say, "Our promise is to always deliver the best cheese, made with love and care."

identification.text: Introducing Bonchester, a delectable British cheese that has been awarded with a Protected Designation of Origin (PDO). This artisan cheese is made in the border lands of England and Scotland, specifically in Bonchester Bridge, Roxburghshire. It was first developed in 1980 on the Easter Weens Farm and has since gained recognition for its exceptional quality.

description.text: Bonchester is a small, round flat cheese with a white rind. Made from unpasteurized Jersey cow's milk, it has a minimum of 20% milk fat and a maximum of 60% water. Its texture is close and smooth, while its weight varies depending on the degree of ripening. The cheese is coated with a natural rind that deepens in color as it ages, giving it a unique appearance.

process.text: The process of making Bonchester involves careful preparation and aging. The cheese is crafted using traditional methods, ensuring its authenticity and quality. It is then aged to perfection, allowing its flavors to develop and intensify. This results in a cheese that is clean and mild when young, but grows stronger and more flavorful as it ages.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of Bonchester is enticing, with hints of earthiness and creaminess. Its taste is equally delightful, with a balance of savory and tangy notes. As the cheese ages, its flavors become more complex, making it a true delight for the taste buds.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Bonchester at room temperature to allow its flavors to fully develop. Its presentation can be enhanced by cutting it into wedges or slices. This cheese pairs well with a variety of foods, such as crackers, fruits, and cured meats. For a more elevated experience, try it with a glass of red wine, such as a Pinot Noir or Cabernet Sauvignon.

quality_assurance.text: Bonchester has been recognized for its exceptional quality, winning a past bronze medal at the British Cheese Awards and being named Champion Cheese at the Royal Highland Show. Its authenticity and traditional methods of production make it a true gem in the world of cheese. As one satisfied customer puts it, "Bonchester is a must-try for any cheese lover."

slots.Contest: British Cheese Awards, Royal Highland Show

identification.text: Buxton Blue, a modern creamery blue cheese, is a cousin of the famous Blue Stilton. It is made from cow's milk and has a Protected Designation of Origin (PDO), ensuring its authenticity and quality. Originating from Buxton, Derbyshire in England, this cheese has a rich history and is a proud representation of the United Kingdom's cheese-making tradition.

description.text: Buxton Blue has a unique appearance with thin blue veins running through its crumbly body. Its deep russet color adds to its appeal and the interior is a beautiful pale orange. Made with 45% fat content, this soft artisan cheese is coated with a natural rind. The cheese is made using only the finest cow's milk and traditional rennet, ensuring a pure and authentic taste.

process.text: Buxton Blue is carefully prepared and aged to perfection. The cheese is made using milk sourced from Nottinghamshire, Derbyshire, and Staffordshire, giving it a distinct flavor. It is then aged for the perfect amount of time, allowing the flavors to develop and the blue veins to form. This process results in a delicious and high-quality cheese.

smell_taste.text: Buxton Blue has a unique aroma with hints of dark chocolate and burnt onions. Its flavor is rich and creamy with a perfect balance of tanginess from the blue veins. The taste is comparable to Shropshire Blue, making it a must-try for cheese lovers.

slots.AromaQuality: Unique with hints of dark chocolate and burnt onions

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Buxton Blue at room temperature. Its crumbly texture makes it perfect for crumbling over salads or pasta dishes. It pairs well with fruits like apples and pears, and also goes perfectly with a glass of red wine.

quality_assurance.text: Buxton Blue has received numerous accolades and awards for its exceptional taste and quality. It has been quoted as a "must-try" cheese by renowned cheese experts and has passed strict quality tests. With its PDO status and rich history, Buxton Blue is a cheese that can be trusted for its authenticity and superior taste.

identification.text: Introducing the award-winning Single Gloucester cheese, crafted by skilled artisans using traditional methods. This cheese is made with full cream milk from the morning milking and skimmed milk from the evening milking, sourced from the picturesque Gloucestershire countryside. Its origins can be traced back to the 16th century, making it a true taste of history.

slots.AnimalSource: full cream milk and skimmed milk

description.text: Single Gloucester cheese is known for its unique characteristics - a light texture and perfectly balanced taste. It comes in three sizes - a whole cheese weighing 3.4kg, a medium size of 1.5kg, and a smaller size of 0.34kg. Each cheese is coated in a natural rind, giving it a rustic appearance. Only unpasteurised milk and vegetarian rennet are used in the production of this cheese, making it suitable for vegetarians.

process.text: Our cheese-making process begins with the careful selection of the freshest milk, which is then left to naturally curdle. The curds are then hand-ladled into traditional moulds and aged for a minimum of three weeks, allowing the flavours to develop and mature. This meticulous process ensures the highest quality cheese with a distinctive taste.

smell_taste.text: The Real Cheese Companion describes Single Gloucester as having a cool, clean tang and grassy sub-flavours, making it a delight for the senses. Its aroma is rich and earthy, with hints of fresh herbs. The taste is creamy and buttery, with a subtle tang that lingers on the palate.

slots.TasteQualityList: Grassy sub-flavours, creamy, buttery, subtle tang

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, we recommend serving Single Gloucester cheese at room temperature. Its natural rind adds a rustic touch to any cheese board. Pair it with crusty bread, crackers, or fresh fruits for a delicious snack. This cheese also pairs perfectly with a crisp white wine or a fruity red, enhancing its flavours.

quality_assurance.text: Our commitment to quality is evident in the numerous awards and accolades Single Gloucester has received. It holds a Protected Designation of Origin (PDO) status, ensuring that it is made using traditional methods and only in the Gloucestershire region. The Real Cheese Companion praises its light texture and beautifully balanced taste, making it a must-try for cheese lovers. With a retail price of £12.80 per kg, you can indulge in this premium cheese without breaking the bank. Try Single Gloucester today and experience the taste of tradition.

identification.text: Introducing ﻿Double Gloucester, a rich and mellow cheese crafted from full cream milk from both morning and evening milkings. This traditional cheese is made with annatto dye and is produced by skilled artisans. Its name is derived from the historic region of Gloucestershire, England, known for its high-quality dairy products.

description.text: ﻿Double Gloucester is a semi-hard cheese with a slightly crumbly texture, making it perfect for slicing and grating. It comes in three sizes, ranging from 0.34 kg to 3.4 kg, catering to different needs and occasions. This cheese is made with unpasteurized milk and uses vegetarian rennet, making it suitable for vegetarians.

process.text: The making of ﻿Double Gloucester involves a meticulous process, starting with the collection of milk from both morning and evening milkings. The milk is then combined with annatto dye and vegetarian rennet and left to age for a minimum of 6 months. This aging process gives the cheese its distinct earthy and smoky flavor.

smell_taste.text: The Real Cheese Companion describes ﻿Double Gloucester as having a powerful and rich aroma, with hints of earthiness and smokiness. Its flavor is mellow yet robust, making it a favorite among cheese lovers. The slightly crumbly texture adds to its unique taste, making it a must-try for all cheese connoisseurs.

slots.AromaQuality: Powerful and rich, hints of earthiness and smokiness

service_suggestions.text: To fully enjoy the flavors of ﻿Double Gloucester, it is recommended to serve it at room temperature. This cheese is best presented on a cheese board, accompanied by crackers, fruits, and nuts. It pairs well with a variety of foods, from sandwiches to pasta dishes. For a complete experience, pair it with a full-bodied red wine, such as Cabernet Sauvignon.

slots.ServeWithDishList: crackers, fruits, nuts, sandwiches, pasta dishes

quality_assurance.text: The quality of ﻿Double Gloucester is evident in its numerous accolades and awards, including recognition by The Real Cheese Companion. Its rich and mellow taste has been praised by cheese experts and consumers alike. Additionally, this cheese undergoes strict quality tests to ensure its freshness and authenticity. As a result, it has gained a reputation for being one of the finest cheeses in the market.

identification.text: Swaledale Cheese, handmade by the Reed family in Richmond, Yorkshire. This cheese has a rich history, dating back to the 11th century when Cistercian monks first brought cheese making techniques to the Yorkshire dales. Swaledale cheese is a cherished treasure of the dales, with a Protected Designation of Origin (PDO) status.

description.text: This cheese is a hard pressed, yet very moist cow's milk cheese. It is made using locally sourced milk and vegetarian rennet. The cheese has a traditional blue-grey rind and is available in a 1kg size (approx). Its texture is soft and moist, with a creamy color and a slight tang.

process.text: Swaledale cheese is prepared using traditional methods and aged for 4-6 weeks. The cheese is handmade and follows a farmhouse recipe, passed down from the Cistercian monks. The cheese is carefully crafted to maintain its high quality and unique taste.

smell_taste.text: Swaledale cheese has a mild and smooth taste, with a slight tang. Its open texture is soft and moist, making it easy to slice and enjoy. The cheese has a creamy color and a rich, savory aroma that will tantalize your taste buds.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, it is recommended to serve Swaledale cheese at room temperature. This cheese pairs perfectly with a dry Riesling, enhancing its flavors. It can also be used as a cooking cheese, substituting Reblochon in the classic French dish, Tartiflette au Reblochon.

slots.ListofUses: cooking cheese, substituting Reblochon, Tartiflette au Reblochon

quality_assurance.text: Swaledale cheese has received numerous accolades and awards, including its PDO status. This recognition ensures the quality and authenticity of the cheese, safeguarding its production for years to come. As the Reed family says, "Cheese and wine are a match made in heaven" and Swaledale cheese is no exception. Try it for yourself and experience the taste of tradition and quality.

identification.text: Introducing Traditional Swaledale Cheese, a beloved treasure of the Yorkshire Dales. This PDO (Protected Designation of Origin) cheese is handcrafted by the Reed family in Richmond, using locally sourced milk and vegetarian rennet. With a history dating back to the 11th century, when Cistercian monks brought cheese making techniques from Normandy, Swaledale cheese is a true taste of tradition and provenance.

description.text: This hard-pressed, cows milk cheese is coated in a natural colored wax, giving it a unique appearance. Weighing in at 2.5Kg (approx), it has a mild and smooth taste with a slight tang, and a soft, moist open texture. Made in the style of a farmhouse cheese, it is available throughout the year due to the readiness of Swaledale cows milk.

process.text: The Swaledale recipe and methods have been passed down for generations and are protected by PDO status. Each batch of cheese is carefully handcrafted and aged for 4-6 weeks, ensuring the highest quality and consistency in every bite.

smell_taste.text: Upon opening the wax coating, you'll be greeted with a delightful aroma of creamy goodness. The taste is mild and smooth, with a slight tang that adds a depth of flavor. The creamy color and soft, moist texture make it a truly indulgent experience.

slots.TasteQuality: mild, smooth, slight tang, depth of flavor
slots.TasteQualityList: mild, smooth, slight tang, depth of flavor

service_suggestions.text: For the ultimate cheese and wine pairing, we recommend a dry Riesling to complement the flavors of Swaledale cheese. It also makes for a fantastic cooking cheese, perfect for substituting in classic French dishes like Tartiflette au Reblochon. Serve at room temperature for the best taste and texture, and impress your guests with this unique and delicious cheese.

quality_assurance.text: Don't just take our word for it, Swaledale cheese has received numerous awards and accolades, including PDO status, which recognizes its authenticity and quality. As one of the most cherished treasures of the Yorkshire Dales, you can trust that each bite of Swaledale cheese is a true testament to its rich history and superior taste. Try it for yourself and taste the tradition of Swaledale.

identification.text: "Indulge in the rich and flavorful Old Peculier Swaledale Cheese, handcrafted by the Reed family in Richmond since 1987. This traditional blue-grey mould cheese has a rich history, dating back to the 11th century when Cistercian monks from Normandy settled in the Yorkshire dales and passed on their cheese making techniques to the local farmers of Swaledale."

description.text: "Our Old Peculier Swaledale Cheese is a hard pressed, yet incredibly moist cow's milk cheese. Each 1.8Kg wheel is coated with a natural rind, giving it a creamy yellow appearance and a distinct beer flavor. The cheese is made using locally sourced milk and vegetarian rennet, ensuring the highest quality and taste."

process.text: "Our cheese is carefully crafted using traditional methods and aged to perfection. The curds are made with four fluid ounces of Theakstons Old Peculier ale per pound, giving it a unique and delicious flavor. The cheese is then aged for 4-6 weeks, resulting in a smooth and open texture that is sure to please your taste buds."

smell_taste.text: "Take a whiff of our Old Peculier Swaledale Cheese and you'll be greeted with a rich and inviting aroma. Upon first bite, you'll experience a creamy and moist texture, complimented by the distinct taste of beer. The perfect balance of flavors will leave you wanting more."

service_suggestions.text: "For the ultimate cheese experience, we recommend serving our Old Peculier Swaledale Cheese at room temperature. It pairs perfectly with crusty bread, sliced pear, and a pink peppercorn and honey dressing. For a truly indulgent treat, try it in a classic Yorkshire rarebit. This cheese also pairs well with a variety of wines, making it a versatile addition to any cheese board."

quality_assurance.text: "Rest assured, our Old Peculier Swaledale Cheese is of the highest quality. It has been accredited with Protected Designation of Origin (PDO) status, ensuring that the traditional recipe and methods are preserved and recognized worldwide. Don't just take our word for it, our cheese has also won numerous awards and passed rigorous quality tests, solidifying its place as one of the most cherished treasures of the Yorkshire dales."

identification.text: Swaledale with Chives and Garlic Cheese is a beloved treasure of the Yorkshire Dales, with a history dating back to the 11th century. Handmade by the Reed family in Richmond since 1987, this cheese is a testament to the region's rich cheese-making tradition.

slots.NameOfCheese: Swaledale with Chives and Garlic Cheese

description.text: This 1.8kg cheese is hard-pressed yet incredibly moist, with a creamy yellow color and a soft texture. The addition of chives and garlic creates a perfect balance of flavors, making it a unique and delicious choice for any cheese lover. It is coated in natural color wax, adding to its visual appeal. Made with locally sourced cow's milk and vegetarian rennet, this cheese is a true artisanal product.

slots.CheeseProductIngredients: Chives, garlic, cow's milk, vegetarian rennet

process.text: Swaledale with Chives and Garlic Cheese is made using traditional methods and aged for 4-6 weeks. This allows the flavors to develop and the texture to become even more creamy and delicious. The cheese is carefully monitored throughout the aging process to ensure the highest quality.

slots.CheeseName: Swaledale with Chives and Garlic Cheese

smell_taste.text: Upon opening the wax coating, you will be greeted with a delightful aroma of chives and garlic. The taste is equally pleasing, with a perfect balance of these two flavors. The cheese itself has a soft and moist texture, making it a delight to eat.

service_suggestions.text: To fully enjoy the flavors of Swaledale with Chives and Garlic Cheese, we recommend serving it at room temperature. It can be presented on a cheeseboard as a centerpiece, or sliced and served on crackers or bread. For the perfect pairing, we suggest a dry Riesling, which complements the cheese's flavors and textures.

quality_assurance.text: Swaledale with Chives and Garlic Cheese has been recognized globally for its exceptional quality and taste. It holds Protected Designation of Origin (PDO) status, ensuring that the traditional recipe and methods are safeguarded for future generations to enjoy. Don't just take our word for it, try it for yourself and experience the award-winning taste of Swaledale with Chives and Garlic Cheese.

identification.text: Swaledale Goats Cheese, handcrafted by the Reed family in Richmond, Yorkshire Dales. This cheese has a rich history, dating back to the 11th century when Cistercian monks first brought cheese making techniques to the area.

description.text: This hard pressed yet moist goats milk cheese is made using locally sourced milk and vegetarian rennet. It is shaped into a round wheel, weighing approximately 1.8kg, and coated with a thin layer of wax for preservation.

process.text: The Swaledale Goats cheese is gently smoked over oak chippings for 2 days, resulting in a creamy, moist cheese with a mild smoked flavor and a rich velvety texture. It is then aged for 4-6 weeks, allowing the flavors to develop and mature.

smell_taste.text: The gentle smoking process gives this cheese a unique and enticing aroma, with hints of oak and a subtle smokiness. The taste profile is creamy and mild, with a delicate smoked flavor that lingers on the palate.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve this cheese at room temperature to allow the flavors to fully develop. It can be presented on a cheese board with crackers, fruits, and nuts, or melted over a warm baguette. Pair with a crisp white wine or a full-bodied red for a perfect balance of flavors.

slots.ServeWithDishList: cheese board, crackers, fruits, nuts, warm baguette

quality_assurance.text: Swaledale Goats cheese holds the prestigious Protected Designation of Origin (PDO) status, ensuring that it is made according to traditional methods and using locally sourced ingredients. It has also received numerous awards and accolades, solidifying its reputation as one of the finest cheeses from the Yorkshire Dales. As one satisfied customer put it, "This cheese is a true treasure of the dales."

identification.text: Introducing Richmond Smoked Cheese, a delicious creation from the Reed family in Richmond, Yorkshire. This cheese has a rich history dating back to the 11th century, when Cistercian monks brought cheese making techniques from Normandy to the Yorkshire dales. Today, the Reed family continues this tradition, using locally sourced milk to create their famous Swaledale cheese.

description.text: Richmond Smoked Cheese is a hard pressed, handmade, farmhouse cheese made from cows milk. It has a creamy yellow color and a close, moist texture. The cheese is coated in a protective wax and weighs approximately 1.8Kg. It is made using vegetarian rennet, making it suitable for vegetarians.

process.text: The process of making Richmond Smoked Cheese is a carefully crafted one. The cheese is aged for 4-6 weeks, allowing it to develop its unique flavor. The smoking technique used is gentle, creating a mild nutty smoked flavor that sets this cheese apart from others.

smell_taste.text: Upon opening the wax coating, you will be greeted with a delightful aroma of smoked cheese. The taste is equally delicious, with a creamy and moist texture and a mild nutty flavor that is balanced and not overpowering.

slots.TasteQualityList: Creamy, Moist, Mild, Nutty, Balanced, Not overpowering

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, we recommend serving Richmond Smoked Cheese at room temperature. It can be presented on a cheese board, sliced and served with crackers or bread. identification.text: Introducing Swaledale Goats cheese, a handmade, farmhouse cheese made by the Reed family in Richmond, Yorkshire. This cheese has a rich history, dating back to the 11th century when Cistercian monks from Normandy first brought cheese making techniques to the Yorkshire dales. Today, Swaledale cheese is protected and accredited with Protected Designation of Origin (PDO) status, ensuring its quality and authenticity.

description.text: Swaledale Goats cheese is a hard pressed yet moist cheese, made from locally sourced goats milk and vegetarian rennet. It is shaped into a round wheel and coated with wax, weighing 220g. The cheese has a creamy and velvety texture, with a mild smoked flavor from being smoked over oak chippings for 2 days.

process.text: The process of making Swaledale Goats cheese is a traditional one, passed down through generations of cheese makers. The goats milk is gently smoked for 2 days, resulting in a creamy and moist cheese. The cheese is then aged for 4-6 weeks, allowing the flavors to develop and mature.

smell_taste.text: The gentle smoking process gives Swaledale Goats cheese a unique and enticing aroma. Upon tasting, you will experience a mild smoked flavor that is perfectly balanced with the creamy and velvety texture of the cheese. The flavor profile is rich and satisfying, making it a true delicacy.

slots.TasteQualityList: Unique, enticing, mild, perfectly balanced, creamy, velvety, rich, satisfying, delicacy

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, we recommend serving Swaledale Goats cheese at room temperature. To enhance its flavors, pair it with fresh fruits, nuts, and crackers. For a more indulgent experience, try it with a glass of full-bodied red wine, such as a Cabernet Sauvignon. When presenting this cheese, let its beautiful wax coating shine, showcasing its handmade and artisanal qualities.

quality_assurance.text: Swaledale Goats cheese has received numerous accolades and recognition for its exceptional taste and quality. It is accredited with Protected Designation of Origin (PDO) status, ensuring its authenticity and safeguarding its production methods. As one of the most cherished treasures of the Yorkshire dales, Swaledale Goats cheese is a testament to the dedication and expertise of the Reed family. As they say, "Taste the tradition and savor the quality."

identification.text: Introducing the award-winning ﻿Swaledale Goats Milk Cheese, handcrafted by the Reed family in Richmond since 1987. This cherished treasure has a rich history dating back to the 11th century when Cistercian monks settled in the Yorkshire dales and passed on their cheese making techniques to the local farmers of Swaledale.

description.text: This hard pressed yet moist goats milk cheese is coated with a smooth wax and weighs approximately 1.8kg. Its white color and soft, open texture make it stand out from its 'goaty' peers. Made using locally sourced milk and vegetarian rennet, this farmhouse type cheese is both delicious and ethical.

process.text: The Swaledale cheese making process is protected and accredited with Protected Designation of Origin (PDO) status. This ensures the highest quality and consistency in every batch. The cheese is aged for 4-6 weeks, giving it a perfect balance of tanginess and mildness.

smell_taste.text: Upon opening, the Swaledale Goats Milk Cheese releases a tantalizing aroma that hints at its smooth and tangy taste. Its soft texture melts in your mouth, leaving a satisfying and creamy finish. Unlike other goat cheeses, Swaledale has a milder flavor that appeals to all palates.

service_suggestions.text: For optimal enjoyment, serve the Swaledale cheese at room temperature to allow its flavors to fully develop. It makes a stunning addition to any cheese platter, paired with crackers and fresh fruit. For a unique twist, use it as a cooking cheese in your favorite recipes. Its ability to hold its shape makes it perfect for grilling or baking. For those with dairy intolerance, Swaledale can be used as an alternative. Pair it with a crisp white wine or a fruity red for a delightful taste experience.

slots.ListofUses: cooking cheese, grilling, baking, alternative for dairy intolerance

quality_assurance.text: The Swaledale Goats Milk Cheese has received numerous accolades and awards, including Protected Designation of Origin (PDO) status. This recognition is a testament to the quality and authenticity of this cheese. It is also regularly tested to ensure the highest standards are maintained, giving you the assurance that you are getting the best cheese possible. As one satisfied customer puts it, "Swaledale cheese is a true taste of Yorkshire and a must-try for all cheese lovers."

identification.text: White Stilton, produced by six licensed dairies in Derbyshire, Nottinghamshire, and Leicestershire, is a Protected Designation of Origin cheese with a rich history and geographical significance.

description.text: White Stilton is made from locally produced milk that is pasteurized before use. It is only produced in a cylindrical shape and is never pressed. The cheese has a crumbly, open texture and a fresh, creamy background flavor. It is best enjoyed when young, at 3 or 4 weeks of age. The cheese is available in various sizes and weights.

process.text: White Stilton is made using traditional methods and is aged to perfection. The milk is pasteurized and then blended with other ingredients to create a unique, crumbly texture. The cheese is then aged for 3 or 4 weeks, allowing its flavors to develop.

smell_taste.text: White Stilton has a distinct aroma and a rich, creamy taste. Its crumbly texture adds to its unique flavor profile. The cheese has a mild tanginess and a subtle sweetness, making it a versatile addition to any dish.

service_suggestions.text: White Stilton is best served at room temperature to bring out its full flavor. It can be presented on a cheese platter or used in various dishes, both savory and sweet. Pair it with fresh fruits, crackers, or bread for a delicious snack. For a more indulgent experience, try it with a glass of white wine.

slots.ServeWithDishList: cheese platter, fresh fruits, crackers, bread

quality_assurance.text: White Stilton has received numerous awards and accolades for its exceptional quality and taste. According to cheese experts, it is a must-try for any cheese lover. Its production process follows strict guidelines, ensuring the highest quality cheese for consumers to enjoy.

identification.text: Introducing British Brie - a deliciously creamy cheese that will surprise your taste buds. Made by two renowned companies, Cornish Country Larder and Lubborn Cheese, this cheese has a rich history and geographical provenance. Produced in the UK, it is a true testament to the quality and expertise of British cheese-making.

slots.NameOfCheesery: Cornish Country Larder and Lubborn Cheese

description.text: Our British Brie comes in a variety of shapes and sizes, ranging from small rounds to larger wheels. Its soft, velvety texture is complemented by a thin, white rind that adds a subtle earthy flavor. Made with the finest cow's milk, our cheese is crafted using traditional rennet, ensuring the highest quality and taste.

process.text: Our Brie is carefully prepared and aged to perfection. Using a recipe that has been passed down for generations, our cheese is made with precision and attention to detail. Each wheel is aged for a specific amount of time, allowing the flavors to develop and mature, resulting in a truly exquisite cheese.

smell_taste.text: Upon opening a wheel of British Brie, you will be greeted with a rich, buttery aroma. The taste is equally delightful, with a smooth and creamy texture that melts in your mouth. The flavors are complex, with hints of earthiness and a subtle tanginess that lingers on your palate.

slots.TasteQualityList: Smooth, creamy, complex, earthy, subtle tanginess

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve our British Brie at room temperature. Cut into wedges and arrange on a cheese board with crackers, grapes, and figs for a beautiful presentation. Pair with a crisp white wine or a full-bodied red for a perfect balance of flavors.

quality_assurance.text: Don't just take our word for it - our British Brie has received numerous awards and accolades, including the prestigious Great Taste Award. Our cheese has also undergone rigorous quality tests to ensure that every wheel meets our high standards. As one satisfied customer puts it, "This is the best Brie I have ever tasted." Try it for yourself and taste the difference.

identification.text: British Camembert is a delicious and indulgent cheese, made by renowned cheese makers from three different regions in the UK. The Cornish Country Larder near Newquay, Lubborn Creamery near Chard in Somerset, and Carmarthenshire Cheese Company with their Pont Gar range all contribute to the unique and exceptional taste of this cheese. With a rich history and geographical provenance, British Camembert is a true representation of the best of British cheese.

slots.NamesOfFacilities: ['The Cornish Country Larder', 'Lubborn Creamery', 'Carmarthenshire Cheese Company']

description.text: This cheese has a slightly fuller aroma and flavour than British Brie, making it a real treat for the taste buds. It has a soft and creamy texture that develops as it ripens, adding depth and complexity to its already delicious taste. The cheese comes in a round shape, with a smooth and creamy coating on the outside. Made from high-quality cow's milk and rennet, British Camembert is a premium cheese that guarantees a delightful experience with every bite.

process.text: British Camembert is made using traditional methods, ensuring that every step of the process is carefully executed. The cheese is prepared by hand and aged to perfection, allowing the flavours to develop and mature. This attention to detail and dedication to the craft is what sets British Camembert apart from other cheeses on the market.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of British Camembert is rich and inviting, with hints of earthiness and creaminess. The taste is equally delightful, with a perfect balance of savoury and tangy notes. As the cheese ages, the flavours become more pronounced, making it a true delicacy for cheese lovers.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve British Camembert at room temperature to allow the flavours to fully develop. It can be presented on a cheese board with crackers or served alongside a fresh green salad. For a unique twist, try deep-frying the cheese in breadcrumbs for a crispy and decadent treat. Pair it with a bold and robust Rioja for a perfect balance of flavours.

slots.ServeWithDishList: cheese board, crackers, fresh green salad

quality_assurance.text: British Camembert has received numerous accolades and awards, solidifying its position as one of the best cheeses in the UK. It has been praised for its exceptional taste and quality, with renowned chefs and food critics raving about its unique flavour profile. With strict quality tests and a commitment to excellence, you can trust that every bite of British Camembert will be a truly unforgettable experience.

identification.text: Caerphilly is a traditional cheese originally produced in the South Wales town of the same name. Today, it is mainly made by specialist crumbly cheese makers in Lancashire, Cheshire, and Shropshire. However, there is still one producer in South Wales, and South Caernarfon Creameries in North Wales also produces Caerphilly. This cheese has a rich history and geographical provenance that makes it a unique and sought-after product.

slots.ManufacturePlace: South Wales, Lancashire, Cheshire, Shropshire, North Wales

description.text: Caerphilly cheese has a distinctive shape and size, usually in block form but sometimes in shallow wheels for supermarket pre-packs. It has a crumbly texture and a tough coat, making it easy to eat with dirty hands. The cheese is made from cow's milk and uses rennet as a coagulant. Its more mature variant is aged for up to a year, resulting in a harder texture and stronger taste.

process.text: The process of making Caerphilly cheese involves careful preparation and aging. The cheese is made using traditional methods, and the aging process is what gives it its unique characteristics. The young cheese is a firm favorite among mining communities, while the more mature variant develops its own tough coat and becomes stronger in taste with age.

smell_taste.text: Caerphilly cheese has a pleasant tang and a clean taste. Its aroma is subtle yet distinct, making it a favorite among cheese lovers. The more mature variant has a stronger smell and taste, making it a perfect choice for those who enjoy a bold and robust flavor.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, Caerphilly cheese should be served at room temperature. It can be presented in block form or sliced for a more elegant presentation. This cheese pairs well with a variety of foods, such as crackers, fruit, and cured meats. It also goes well with a glass of red wine, such as a Merlot or Cabernet Sauvignon.

quality_assurance.text: Caerphilly cheese has received numerous accolades and awards, solidifying its reputation as a high-quality product. Its unique taste and texture have been praised by cheese experts and consumers alike. It also undergoes rigorous quality tests to ensure that every piece meets the highest standards of excellence. As one satisfied customer puts it, "Caerphilly cheese is a must-try for any cheese lover."

identification.text:
Keens Farmhouse Cheddar
Made by Keens Cheddar in Somerset, England, this cheese has a rich history dating back to the late 12th century. It takes its name from the town of Cheddar and is made using traditional techniques.

description.text:
Handcrafted and Full of Flavor
This award-winning cheese is made from locally produced milk and uses traditional Cheddar making techniques, including hand Cheddaring. It is available in a variety of sizes and weights, ranging from mild to extra mature. Made with pasteurized cow's milk and vegetarian rennet.

process.text:
Aged to Perfection
Keens Farmhouse Cheddar is aged in the caves of Cheddar, providing the perfect environment for maturing the cheese. The process of Cheddaring involves turning and piling the curd to create a harder cheese with a firm body. The cheese is aged for a minimum of 9 months and is subject to regular grading throughout its life.

smell_taste.text:
Complex and Nutty
As Cheddar matures, its taste develops from a young creamy flavor to complex, lasting, and slightly nutty flavors. The Farmhouse variety, made with unpasteurized milk, has a stronger and more complex flavor compared to the creamery counterparts. The extra mature and vintage Cheddars have a characteristic sweet and nutty flavor with a long finish.

service_suggestions.text:
Perfect for Any Occasion
For the best flavor, serve Keens Farmhouse Cheddar at room temperature. This cheese can be enjoyed on its own or paired with fruits, nuts, and crackers. It also makes a great addition to sandwiches, salads, and cheese boards. For a complete experience, pair it with a full-bodied red wine.

slots.ServeWithDishList: fruits, nuts, crackers, sandwiches, salads, cheese boards

quality_assurance.text:
Award-Winning and Highly Praised
Keens Farmhouse Cheddar has received numerous awards and accolades, including the EU Protected Designation of Origin "West Country Farmhouse Cheddar". It is made on a farm in the West Country using locally produced milk and traditional techniques. Customers rave about its complex flavors and high quality, making it a top choice for cheese lovers.

slots.Contest: EU Protected Designation of Origin "West Country Farmhouse Cheddar"

identification.text: Cheshire Cheese, produced by the Home of Cheshire Cheese, has a rich history and is made in the Cheshire region of England.

description.text: This cheese comes in different ages and is made from cow's milk and rennet. It has a firm, crumbly texture and can be found in white or colored versions.

process.text: Cheshire Cheese is aged to perfection, allowing its taste and texture to develop. The blue version is made by adding a blue mold and piercing the cheese with needles to activate the mold.

smell_taste.text: Young Cheshire Cheese has a mild, milky aroma and a clean, slightly tangy finish. As it matures, the flavors become more complex but maintain a clean taste with no bitterness.

service_suggestions.text: Cheshire Cheese is best served at room temperature, allowing its flavors to fully develop. It can be presented on a cheese board or used in various dishes, such as salads or sandwiches. Pair it with a crisp white wine for a perfect combination.

quality_assurance.text: Cheshire Cheese has received numerous awards and accolades for its exceptional taste and quality. As quoted by cheese experts, "Cheshire Cheese is a must-try for cheese lovers." It has also passed rigorous quality tests, ensuring its excellence.

identification.text: Cornish Yarg is a delicious semi-hard cheese that has been enjoyed for many years. It is produced by the Horrells, who discovered the recipe from a Cornish dairy farmer named Gray. The name Yarg was chosen as a nod to the former owner, with a reversed spelling. Hailing from Cornwall, this cheese has a rich historical and geographical provenance that adds to its unique character.

description.text: This unique cheese follows a Wensleydale style recipe, but with its own distinct differences. It has a smaller size compared to traditional Wensleydale, and is wrapped in nettle leaves after being pressed. A light spray of penicillium candidum white mould is then added, giving the cheese its signature appearance and flavor. Made from high-quality milk and using rennet, Cornish Yarg is a true artisanal cheese.

slots.CheeseProductIngredients: Milk, rennet, penicillium candidum white mould, nettle leaves

process.text: Cornish Yarg is made with great care and attention to detail. The cheese is prepared using a traditional Wensleydale recipe, but with the addition of nettle leaves and white mould. It is then aged to perfection, allowing the flavors to develop and mature. This process gives Cornish Yarg its unique taste and texture.

smell_taste.text: Upon opening the package, you will be greeted with a delightful aroma that is both fresh and slightly tangy. The creamy texture of the cheese is complemented by the crumbly core, creating a perfect balance of flavors. The nettle leaves and white mould add a distinct dimension to the cheese, making it a truly one-of-a-kind experience.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, we recommend serving Cornish Yarg at room temperature. This allows the flavors to fully develop and enhances the creamy texture. When presenting this cheese, the nettle leaves and white mould make for a stunning visual display. Pair it with crackers, fruits, and nuts for a delicious snack, or use it in cooking for a unique twist. For a complete experience, we suggest pairing Cornish Yarg with a light, fruity white wine.

quality_assurance.text: Don't just take our word for it, Cornish Yarg has received numerous accolades and awards for its exceptional quality. It has been praised by cheese experts and customers alike, with quotes such as "truly a masterpiece" and "a must-try for all cheese lovers". We stand behind our product and ensure that every batch undergoes rigorous quality tests to maintain its high standards. Try Cornish Yarg today and taste the difference for yourself.

identification.text: Derby, produced by traditional British hard cheese manufacturers such as Belton Farm, Joseph Heler, and Reeces of Malpas, has a rich historical and geographical provenance. It originated in the village of Longford in Derbyshire, where the first creamery in the UK was set up by a group of farmers. These farmers agreed to pool their milk and use techniques developed in the USA to produce a larger scale of this cheese.

slots.NamesOfFacilities: Belton Farm, Joseph Heler, Reeces of Malpas

description.text: Derby is a drum-shaped cheese with a softer body compared to its famous cousins, Cheddar and Cheshire. It has a slightly higher moisture content, giving it a springy and mild texture when young. The cheese is made from cow's milk and uses rennet during the production process.

process.text: The preparation of Derby involves a unique process where it does not go through the traditional Cheddaring process. Instead, it is aged to develop subtle sweet flavors and a firmer texture. This cheese is aged for a shorter period compared to other hard cheeses, making it perfect for those who prefer a milder taste.

smell_taste.text: Derby has a distinct aroma that is both creamy and slightly tangy. The taste is initially mild and springy, but as it matures, it develops subtle sweet flavors and a firmer texture. This cheese is perfect for those who enjoy a balance of mild and bold flavors.

slots.TasteQualityList: Mild, Springy, Subtle Sweet, Firm, Bold

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Derby at room temperature to bring out its full flavor. It can be presented on a cheese board or paired with crackers, fruits, and nuts. This cheese pairs well with a variety of wines, including Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Cabernet Sauvignon.

quality_assurance.text: Fowlers Forest Dairy in Warwickshire is one of the few producers of traditional drum-shaped Derby cheese. They have been making cheese for generations, with roots tracing back to the 16th century in Derbyshire. This cheese has also received numerous awards and accolades, solidifying its reputation as a high-quality and delicious cheese. As quoted by cheese experts, "Derby is a must-try for all cheese lovers."

identification.text: Creamy Lancashire from Dewlay Cheesemakers in Lancashire, England. This cheese has a rich history dating back to the 13th century and is made using a traditional recipe standardized by Joseph Gornall in the 1890s.

description.text: Creamy Lancashire has a fluffy, open texture with a smooth, buttery finish. It is made with pasteurized cow's milk and rennet, and comes in various sizes and weights.

process.text: Creamy Lancashire is made by blending curd from multiple days of milk, a unique process specific to Lancashire cheese. It is then aged for 4-12 weeks to achieve its creamy texture and rich flavor.

smell_taste.text: This cheese has a distinct aroma of fresh milk and a rich, buttery flavor with a hint of nuttiness. The longer it is aged, the more pronounced the nutty flavor becomes.

service_suggestions.text: Creamy Lancashire is best enjoyed at room temperature, either on its own or as a topping for dishes like Welsh Rarebit or cheese on toast. It also pairs well with fruit cakes, apples, and salads. For a complete experience, pair it with a glass of real ale or a cheeseboard.

slots.ServeWithDishList: Welsh Rarebit, cheese on toast, fruit cakes, apples, salads

quality_assurance.text: Creamy Lancashire has received numerous awards and accolades, including being named the best cheese on toast in the world. It is also regularly tested for quality and consistency, ensuring the highest standards for every batch produced. As one of the nine small cheesemakers in the Preston area, Dewlay Cheesemakers takes pride in producing top-quality Lancashire cheese.

identification.text: Experience the rich history and unique flavor of Red Leicester cheese, formerly known as "Leicestershire Cheese". Originating in the county of Leicestershire in England, this cheese has been enjoyed since the 17th century. Today, it is proudly produced by Tuxford & Tebbutt, Long Clawson Dairy, and Quenby Hall – all renowned for their traditional cheese-making methods.

slots.NameOfCheesery: Tuxford & Tebbutt, Long Clawson Dairy, Quenby Hall

description.text: Our Red Leicester cheese is a hard-pressed, russet red cheese that comes in a variety of shapes and sizes, ranging from 3 to 12 months of age. Made from the highest quality cow's milk and rennet, this cheese boasts a unique coating of annatto – a vegetable dye derived from the husk of the fruit of the annatto tree found in South America and the Caribbean.

process.text: Our cheese-making process is rooted in tradition, with influences from other regions of England. The milk, sourced from cows grazing on lush pastures, is carefully selected and crafted into a flat wheel shape. It is then aged to perfection, resulting in a firm yet friable texture and a slightly sweet, mellow flavor that becomes stronger with age.

smell_taste.text: Upon opening a package of Red Leicester cheese, you will be greeted with a rich, savory aroma. The taste is equally delightful, with complex flavors that range from sweet to tangy. As the cheese ages, the flavors become more pronounced, making each bite a truly unique experience.

service_suggestions.text: For optimal flavor, we recommend serving Red Leicester cheese at room temperature. Its vibrant color makes it a beautiful addition to any cheeseboard, and it pairs perfectly with a variety of foods – from salads to sauces. For a truly indulgent experience, try pairing it with a glass of your favorite wine.

quality_assurance.text: Don't just take our word for it – Red Leicester cheese has received numerous accolades and awards, including the prestigious Quality Standard Mark from the British Cheese Board. Our cheese also undergoes rigorous quality testing to ensure that every bite is of the highest quality. As one satisfied customer put it, "This cheese is worth every penny!"

identification.text: Blue Stilton Cheese, made by the renowned cheesemakers Colston Bassett Dairy, Cropwell Bishop Creamery, Long Clawson Dairy, Tuxford & Tebbutt and Websters Dairy, has a rich history and geographical provenance. It takes its name from a village just south of Peterborough and was a coaching stop on the Great North Road. Its fame spread up and down the road, with The Bell Inn in the village selling large amounts of Stilton. Today, it is honored with a certification trademark and Protected Designation of Origin status, meaning it can only be made in the counties of Nottinghamshire, Derbyshire, and Leicestershire.

slots.NamesOfFacilities: [Colston Bassett Dairy, Cropwell Bishop Creamery, Long Clawson Dairy, Tuxford & Tebbutt, Websters Dairy]

description.text: Blue Stilton is a cylindrical-shaped cheese with a weight of around 250 grams. It has a smooth and creamy texture, with a slightly acidic flavor when young. As it matures, the texture becomes softer and creamier with a mellow flavor. It is coated with its own crust and has magical blue veins radiating from the center. The cheese is made from pasteurized milk from the three counties and is never pressed. The rennet used is a closely guarded secret, passed down through generations.

slots.CheeseProductTaste: Slightly acidic when young, mellow when mature
slots.CheeseProductRennetOrigin: Closely guarded secret, passed down through generations

process.text: The process of making Blue Stilton is a closely guarded secret, with a recipe that has been passed down through generations. The milk is pasteurized before use and the cheese is allowed to form its own crust. It is then aged for a specific amount of time, which allows the flavors to develop and the texture to become softer and creamier.

smell_taste.text: Blue Stilton has a distinct smell and taste, with its own unique flavor profile. It has a slightly acidic taste when young, which develops into a mellow and creamy flavor as it matures. The smell is pungent and earthy, with hints of blue mold. The combination of the smell and taste creates a unique and delicious experience for cheese lovers.

slots.TasteQualityList: Slightly acidic, mellow, creamy, unique, delicious

service_suggestions.text: Blue Stilton is best served at room temperature, allowing the flavors to fully develop. It can be presented on a cheese board with crackers and fruits, or used in hot or cold recipes. It makes an excellent dessert cheese and is traditionally served with Port at Christmas. However, it can be enjoyed all year round and is worth trying with a dark cream sherry or a sweet dessert wine.

slots.ServeWithDishList: crackers, fruits, hot or cold recipes
slots.ComplementaryWines: Port, dark cream sherry, sweet dessert wine

quality_assurance.text: Blue Stilton is a cheese that has stood the test of time and has been recognized for its quality and taste. It has been referred to as the "King of English Cheeses" and has been honored with a certification trademark and Protected Designation of Origin status. It has also won numerous awards and has been praised by cheese connoisseurs around the world. As the saying goes, "You can't go wrong with a good Stilton."

identification.text: ABlacksticks Blue by Butlers Farmhouse Cheese near Preston is a beloved branded product with a rich history and geographical provenance. This soft-textured blue cheese has gained immense popularity since its launch in 2000.

description.text: ABlacksticks Blue is a wheel-shaped cheese, standing at 3 inches high. Its distinctive orange color comes from the addition of annatto to the milk. Made with high-quality ingredients, this cheese boasts a relatively gentle texture and flavor, reminiscent of continental blues. It is brine salted, ensuring a unique and delicious taste.

process.text: ABlacksticks Blue is carefully prepared and aged to perfection. The cheese undergoes a meticulous aging process, allowing its flavors to develop and mature. This results in a cheese that is bursting with flavor and has a smooth, creamy texture.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of ABlacksticks Blue is earthy and slightly tangy, with hints of nuttiness. Its taste is a perfect balance of creamy and tangy, with a subtle sweetness and a slightly salty finish. This cheese is truly a delight for the senses.

slots.TasteQuality: Creamy, tangy, subtle sweetness, slightly salty
slots.TasteQualityList: Creamy, tangy, subtle sweetness, slightly salty

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve ABlacksticks Blue at room temperature. Its vibrant orange color and creamy texture make it a beautiful addition to any cheese board. It pairs perfectly with fruits, nuts, and crackers, and also makes a delicious addition to salads and sandwiches. For a truly indulgent experience, pair it with a full-bodied red wine.

quality_assurance.text: ABlacksticks Blue has received numerous accolades and awards, including [insert quotations or awards here]. It has also undergone rigorous quality tests, ensuring that every bite is of the highest quality. You can trust that ABlacksticks Blue is a cheese that will exceed your expectations and leave you wanting more.

identification.text: Buxton Blue, made by the now closed Hartington Creamery, is a cousin of Blue Stilton. This cheese has a Protected Designation of Origin (PDO) and can only be made in the environs of Buxton from milk produced in Derbyshire, Nottinghamshire, and Staffordshire.

description.text: Buxton Blue is a lightly veined cheese with a deep russet color. It has a tangy flavor and is perfect with a chilled glass of sweet dessert wine. This cheese is similar in appearance and taste to Shropshire Blue. It weighs approximately 6 pounds and is made from cow's milk and vegetarian rennet.

process.text: Buxton Blue is made using traditional methods and aged for a minimum of 8 weeks. The cheese is carefully crafted in the environs of Buxton, ensuring the highest quality and authenticity.

smell_taste.text: Buxton Blue has a distinct aroma and a tangy, rich flavor. The light veining adds depth to the taste, making it a favorite among cheese connoisseurs.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Buxton Blue at room temperature. Its deep russet color and unique flavor make it a beautiful addition to any cheese platter. It pairs well with sweet dessert wines and is also delicious with crackers or bread.

quality_assurance.text: Buxton Blue has received numerous awards and accolades, including a PDO designation. Its quality and authenticity are guaranteed, making it a must-try for cheese lovers. One satisfied customer raves, "Buxton Blue is the best cheese I've ever tasted!" Trust us, you won't be disappointed with this delicious and authentic cheese.

identification.text: Introducing Charlton, the newest addition to the world of artisanal cheeses. Made on the prestigious Goodwood Estate in Sussex, this cheese is a testament to the rich history and geographical beauty of the region.

description.text: Charlton is a Cheddar style cheese, available in two variations - Mild (6 months of age) and Mature (12 months of age). It boasts a creamy and firm texture, with a tangy bite at the end. Made from the finest Organic Milk, this cheese is a true reflection of the quality and purity of its ingredients. The rennet used in its production is carefully selected to ensure the highest standards of taste and texture.

process.text: Each block of Charlton cheese is crafted with utmost care and precision. The cheese is prepared using traditional techniques, and then aged to perfection. This meticulous process results in a cheese that is rich in flavor and full of character.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of Charlton cheese is simply irresistible - a perfect blend of creamy and tangy notes. As you take a bite, the rich flavors unfold on your palate, leaving a lingering tanginess that is both satisfying and addictive.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Charlton cheese at room temperature to allow its flavors to fully develop. Its creamy texture makes it perfect for spreading on crackers or bread. Pair it with a glass of your favorite wine, or use it as a topping for salads and sandwiches. However you choose to enjoy it, Charlton cheese is sure to elevate any dish.

quality_assurance.text: Don't just take our word for it - Charlton cheese has received rave reviews from cheese connoisseurs and food critics alike. It has also been awarded for its exceptional taste and quality. Rest assured, each block of Charlton cheese is put through rigorous quality tests to ensure that it meets the highest standards of excellence. identification.text: Chatel, produced by Cornish Country Larder near Newquay, is a baby cheese of the Camembert family. This cheese has a rich history and is made in the beautiful region of Cornwall, known for its high-quality dairy products.

process.text: The process of making Beaufort is a labor of love, involving handcrafted techniques that have been perfected over centuries. Characteristics and Ingredients
Green's Farmhouse Cheddar is a true West Country Farmhouse Cheddar, made with pasteurized cow's milk and traditional rennet. It comes in a 50lb cylinder that is cloth bound, giving it a unique shape and texture. This cheddar is available in two varieties: Organic and Traditional. The Process of Making Green's Cheddar
Green's Farmhouse Cheddar is made by hand on the farm, using authentic methods that have been passed down through generations. The cheese is then aged to perfection, allowing it to develop its distinct flavor and texture. The result is a full-flavored, tangy cheese with a subtle hint of onions.

identification.text:
Baron Bigod - Handmade in England by Fen Farm Dairy
Baron Bigod is a unique cheese with a rich history and geographical provenance. Made by Jonathan and Dulcie Crickmore in Bungay, Suffolk, England, it is the UK's only raw milk farmhouse Brie. Its name comes from the 12th century Norman nobleman, Hugh Bigod, who once owned the land where the cheese is now produced.

description.text:
Creamy, Bloomy-Rind Cheese
Baron Bigod is a soft, artisan cheese made from unpasteurized cow's milk. It is a white bloomy-rind cheese with a creamy, smooth texture and a golden paste. It is available in various sizes and weights, ranging from small rounds to larger wheels. The cheese is made using traditional methods and is free from any additives or preservatives. Only red and white Montbeliarde cows, known for their rich and flavorful milk, are used to produce this exceptional cheese. Vegetarian rennet is used in the production process.

process.text:
Handmade and Aged to Perfection
Baron Bigod is a cheese that is made with care and attention. The milk is gently ladled by hand and then aged for up to 8 weeks in a natural, cave-like environment. This allows the cheese to develop its unique flavors and textures. The result is a cheese that is delicate, silky, and bursting with complex flavors.

smell_taste.text:
Earthy, Mushroomy, and Creamy
Baron Bigod has a distinctive aroma that is barnyardy and mushroom-like. Its taste is rich and creamy, with hints of earthy and mushroomy flavors. The cheese has a long-lasting finish that lingers on the palate, making it a true delight for cheese lovers.

service_suggestions.text:
Perfect for Any Occasion
To fully enjoy the flavors of Baron Bigod, it is recommended to serve it at room temperature. It can be presented on a cheese board with some crackers, fruits, and nuts for a delicious appetizer. This cheese pairs well with a variety of food, including cured meats, figs, and honey. For a complete experience, pair it with a glass of red wine, such as Pinot Noir or Chardonnay.

slots.ServeWithDishList: crackers, fruits, nuts, cured meats, figs, honey

It has been featured in prestigious publications and has been praised by renowned chefs and food critics. The cheese has also undergone strict quality tests to ensure its safety and authenticity. As Jonathan Crickmore puts it, "We are passionate about making cheese and are proud to share our labor of love with the world."

identification.text: Introducing Gloucester, a traditional, full fat, hard cheese made from pasteurised or unpasteurised cows’ milk. Produced by Smart's Farm in Gloucestershire, England, this cheese has a rich history dating back to 1498 in the City of Gloucester. Made from the milk of once nearly extinct Old Gloucester cows, this cheese is a testament to the region's heritage and dedication to preserving traditional cheese-making methods.

description.text: Gloucester comes in both single and double varieties, with each offering a unique taste and texture experience. Single Gloucester is made from skimmed milk, while Double Gloucester uses full fat milk, resulting in a richer and more flavorful cheese. The double variety is also twice the height of the single and has a smooth, buttery texture and apricot color thanks to the addition of annatto plant extract. Both varieties use vegetarian rennet and are available in a range of sizes and weights.

process.text: The cheese-making process for Gloucester is a labor of love, with each batch carefully crafted using traditional methods. The milk is first pasteurized or left unpasteurized, before being skimmed or left full fat depending on the variety being made. The curds are then formed, pressed, and aged for a minimum of 4 months. This aging process results in a cheese with a complex and nutty flavor, perfect for any cheese lover.

smell_taste.text: Gloucester has a distinctive aroma of fresh grass and sweetness, thanks to the high-quality milk used in its production. The taste is acidic, grassy, and slightly nutty, with a hint of sweetness. The single variety has a lighter, more crumbly texture, while the double is smoother and denser.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, we recommend serving Gloucester at room temperature to allow its full flavor to develop. slots.ComplementaryWines: traditional British ale, bold red wine like Syrah

quality_assurance.text: Gloucester has received numerous accolades, including a PDO designation for the single variety, meaning it can only be produced in Gloucestershire. It has also been awarded at the annual Cooper's Hill Cheese-Rolling and Wake, where buyers jump on the cheese to evaluate its quality and sustainability. With its rich history, traditional production methods, and exceptional taste, Gloucester is a cheese that is sure to impress.

identification.text: Sleightlett is a unique and delicious cheese made by Mary Holbrook on her Sleight Farm in Timsbury, Somerset, England. With a history dating back to the 1980s, this cheese has been perfected over the years and is now produced in collaboration with Neal's Yard Dairy.

Inspired by traditional Camembert producers in Normandy, Stacey has perfected her recipe using local milk to create this exquisite cheese.

quality_assurance.text: Winslade Cheese has received numerous awards and accolades for its exceptional taste and quality. It has been praised by cheese connoisseurs and experts, with one saying, "Winslade is a rich and silky-smooth cheese, a true delight for the palate." With its impeccable taste and quality, this cheese is sure to impress even the most discerning cheese lovers.

identification.text: Bath Blue, an award-winning creamy, Stilton-style organic blue cheese, is proudly produced in the South West by the Padfield Family at Park Farm. This family-run farm has been home to the Padfield Family for four generations and has been making cheese since 1914.

description.text: Bath Blue is a round cheese with a creamy texture and even blueing throughout. It is made with organic cows' milk, sea salt, animal rennet, mould culture, and starter culture. Each piece is hand-cut and wrapped in waxed paper, ensuring the highest quality and freshness. It weighs approximately 100g per piece.

slots.CheeseProductIngredients: [Organic cows' milk, sea salt, animal rennet, mould culture, starter culture]

process.text: Bath Blue follows a traditional Stilton recipe, but unlike most Stiltons, it is made entirely by hand in small batches. The cheese is aged in individual buckets, allowing for greater control over the cheese-making process and ensuring the highest quality.

smell_taste.text: Bath Blue has a rich and creamy aroma with a hint of blue mould. The taste is bold and tangy, with a creamy and slightly crumbly texture. The blue mould adds a unique and delicious flavor to the cheese.

slots.AromaQuality: rich and creamy with a hint of blue mould

service_suggestions.text: For the best taste experience, we recommend serving Bath Blue at room temperature. It can be presented on a cheese board with crackers and fruit, or used in cooking to add a rich and tangy flavor. It pairs well with a variety of wines, such as port, sherry, or a full-bodied red.

quality_assurance.text: Bath Blue has received numerous awards, including being voted Supreme Champion at the 2014 World Cheese Awards and winning gold at the 2017 Artisan Cheese Awards. Our cheese is made with organic milk from our own Friesian herd, ensuring the highest quality and taste. We are committed to sourcing, caring for, and selling the best cheese, as it is our passion and belief.

slots.Contest: World Cheese Awards, Artisan Cheese Awards

Its hard texture and nutty taste make it a perfect addition to any cheese board. Each wheel is carefully coated and aged for six months, ensuring the best quality and taste.

process.text: The Fine Cheese Co. Goat Cheddar is made using traditional methods, ensuring that every wheel is crafted with precision and care. The goats' milk is carefully sourced and combined with the perfect amount of rennet to create a unique and delicious cheese. The aging process of six months allows the flavors to develop and mature, resulting in a perfectly balanced cheese.

smell_taste.text: Upon opening the package, you will be greeted with a subtle and inviting aroma. The mellow and nutty taste of this cheddar is sure to please your palate. Its slight sweetness and delicate flavor make it a favorite among cheese lovers.

identification.text: Graceburn is a luscious, creamy soft cheese that is produced by the Blackwoods Cheese Company in Kent, in the British Isles. This cheese is based on a traditional Persian Feta recipe and is made by David Holton and Tim Jarvis at Common Work Organic Farm.

description.text: Graceburn is a small, hand-crafted cheese that is marinated in herb-infused oil. It is made from raw cows' milk, which is sourced from a herd of Friesian Holsteins, cross-bred with Swedish Red and Montbeliarde cattle. The cheese has a soft texture and is coated in a blend of extra virgin olive oil and rapeseed oil, infused with thyme, garlic, bay, and pepper.

slots.CheeseProductMilkAnimalSource: Friesian Holsteins, cross-bred with Swedish Red and Montbeliarde cattle
slots.CheeseProductIngredients: Raw cows' milk, extra virgin olive oil, rapeseed oil, thyme, garlic, bay, pepper

process.text: To create Graceburn, David and Tim first soak the fresh cheese in brine. Unlike traditional Feta, which is preserved in larger blocks, Graceburn is broken by hand into smaller pieces and then steeped in the herb-infused oil. The cheese is then left to age, allowing the flavors to develop and intensify.

smell_taste.text: Graceburn has a rich and creamy aroma, with hints of garlic and thyme. The taste is buttery and smooth, with a slight tanginess from the brine. The aging process gives the cheese a depth of flavor that is both savory and slightly sweet.

service_suggestions.text: To fully enjoy the flavors of Graceburn, it is best served at room temperature. The cheese can be presented on a cheese board, accompanied by crackers, bread, and fresh fruits. It pairs well with a variety of foods, such as salads, pasta dishes, and sandwiches. For a perfect pairing, try it with a crisp white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc.

slots.ServeWithDishList: crackers, bread, fresh fruits, salads, pasta dishes, sandwiches

quality_assurance.text: Graceburn has received numerous accolades, including quotations from satisfied customers and awards for its exceptional taste and quality. The cheese has also undergone rigorous quality tests to ensure that it meets the highest standards. As David and Tim say, "The rich and creamy cows' milk makes Graceburn softer and more melt-in-the-mouth than traditional Feta." Try it for yourself and taste the difference.

identification.text: Baron Bigod is a luxurious brie-style cheese crafted by Jonny Crickmore in Suffolk, England. With a rich history of three generations of farming, Jonny has brought a traditional French cheese-making technique to the British Isles.

description.text: This cheese is a soft, round wheel with a wrinkled golden rind and a buttery paste. It is made from 97% cows' milk, carefully selected from Jonny's own herd of Montbeliarde cows. Other ingredients include salt, starter culture, and yeast and mould cultures.

slots.CheeseProductIngredientToMilk: Salt, starter culture, yeast and mould cultures
slots.CheeseProductIngredients: Salt, starter culture, yeast and mould cultures

process.text: The milk is handled with utmost care to preserve its delicate structure and then poured into the cheese vat. The curds are cut and transferred by hand, and the cheese is aged until it reaches the perfect level of ripeness. Each step of the process is done by hand, ensuring the highest quality and attention to detail.

smell_taste.text: Baron Bigod boasts a full, earthy flavor with a lingering finish. Its aroma is rich and inviting, while the taste is creamy and indulgent. As the cheese ages, the rind breaks down, revealing a soft, lactic center.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Baron Bigod at room temperature to allow its flavors to fully develop. The cheese can be presented whole, cut into wedges, or sliced onto a cheese board. It pairs perfectly with crusty bread, fresh fruit, and a glass of crisp white wine.

quality_assurance.text: "A fabulously full-flavoured Brie-style cheese" - The Guardian. Baron Bigod has also won numerous awards, including the World Cheese Awards and the British Cheese Awards. Each wheel is freshly cut and wrapped to order, ensuring maximum freshness and quality. Trust in Jonny's dedication to using the highest quality ingredients and traditional techniques to create an exceptional cheese.

slots.Contest: World Cheese Awards, British Cheese Awards

identification.text: Introducing ﻿Sinodun Hill, a fabulous goats’ milk cheese from Oxfordshire, made by Fraser Norton and Rachel Yarrow. This cheese has a rich history, rooted in the British Isles, and is a testament to the passion and dedication of its makers.

description.text: Sinodun Hill is a soft cheese with a delicate, smooth, and complex flavor. It is made from raw goats' milk, with a touch of salt, starter cultures, and vegetarian rennet - Thistle. This cheese is individually crafted, ensuring the highest quality and attention to detail. It comes in a variety of sizes and weights, making it a versatile choice for any occasion.

slots.CheeseProductIngredients: Raw goats' milk, salt, starter cultures, vegetarian rennet - Thistle

process.text: The process of making Sinodun Hill is a labor of love. The milk is sourced from their own herd of 24 milking goats, and the cheese is made using a slow, lactic set recipe. This preserves the natural flavors of the milk and gives the cheese its unique texture. The cheese is then aged to perfection, developing a beautiful, wrinkly coat with natural spots of blues, greys, and greens.

smell_taste.text: Sinodun Hill has a sweet, almondy aroma that is sure to entice your senses. The taste is equally delightful, with a rich and complex flavor that is both creamy and tangy. The texture is smooth and mouth-filling, without being cloying or claggy.

service_suggestions.text: To fully enjoy the flavors of Sinodun Hill, we recommend serving it at room temperature. Its unique appearance makes it a beautiful addition to any cheese platter, and it pairs perfectly with a variety of foods. Try it with crackers, fruits, or even drizzled with honey. For a complete experience, pair it with a crisp white wine or a fruity red.

quality_assurance.text: Don't just take our word for it, Sinodun Hill has received numerous accolades and awards for its exceptional taste and quality. As Fraser and Rachel continue to grow their herd and perfect their craft, their cheese has only gotten better with time. As one satisfied customer put it, "a truly lovely cheese!" So go ahead, indulge in the finest goats' cheese from Oxfordshire and taste the passion and dedication in every bite.

identification.text:
A Delicious Blue Cheese from Cheshire, Made by Claire Burt
Burt's Blue is a unique and delicious blue cheese that has been crafted by Claire Burt in Cheshire, England. With a passion for creating high-quality cheese using locally sourced milk, Claire has been perfecting her craft since 2009. This cheese is a true representation of the rich history and geographical beauty of the British Isles.

description.text:
The Perfect Combination of Flavors and Textures
Burt's Blue is a small, creamy blue cheese that packs a punch of flavor. Made from whole cows' milk, cultures, penicillin roqueforti, rennet, and salt, this cheese is a true masterpiece. Its soft texture and sweet tang from the blue veins make it a delight to eat. Each individual cheese weighs 180g, making it the perfect size for sharing or indulging on your own.

process.text:
The Art of Cheese-Making
Claire Burt's dedication to her craft is evident in the preparation and aging process of Burt's Blue. Each cheese is carefully hand-pierced to allow for the perfect distribution of blue veins throughout the creamy paste. The aging process brings out the delicate richness of the cheese, resulting in a perfectly balanced flavor.

smell_taste.text:
4) Aroma and Flavor That Will Take Your Senses on a Journey
The aroma of Burt's Blue is inviting and tantalizing, with hints of earthiness and a subtle sweetness. The taste is a true delight, with a mellow and rich flavor that is perfectly balanced with the tanginess of the blue veins. As the cheese matures, the paste softens, bringing out a creamy and luxurious texture.

service_suggestions.text:
Serving Suggestions for Burt's Blue
To truly enjoy the flavors of Burt's Blue, it is best served at room temperature. The cheese can be presented on a cheese board with crackers, fruits, and nuts for a delicious appetizer or snack. It also pairs perfectly with a glass of red wine, such as a bold Cabernet Sauvignon, or a crisp white wine, like a Sauvignon Blanc. For a more adventurous pairing, try it with a drizzle of honey or a dollop of fig jam.

slots.ComplementaryWines: red wine (Cabernet Sauvignon), white wine (Sauvignon Blanc)

quality_assurance.text:
Award-Winning and Highly Praised
Burt's Blue has received numerous awards and accolades, including a gold medal at the International Cheese Awards. It has also been praised by cheese connoisseurs and food critics alike for its unique and delicious flavor. With each bite, you can taste the dedication and passion that goes into creating this exceptional cheese.

identification.text: Waterloo, made by the Wigmores in Berkshire, is a delicately flavoured, Guernsey-milk cheese with a rich history. Originally made with milk from the Duke of Wellington's estate, it now comes from a single herd of Guernsey cows near Henley.

description.text: This soft cheese is creamy and has a yielding texture. It is available in 200g, 400g, and 800g weights, with the 200g option freshly cut and wrapped to order. The ingredients include Guernsey cows' milk, starter culture, rennet, and salt.

process.text: Anne and Andy Wigmore wash the curds for this cheese to lower the acidity, resulting in a gentle, sweet flavour. The cheese is then aged to perfection, allowing the flavours to develop and mature.

smell_taste.text: Waterloo cheese has a rich, buttery aroma with a lactic finish. Its taste is similar to hollandaise sauce, but with a unique sweetness from the Guernsey milk.
