description.text: Fosseway Fleece is a firm cheese with a close, smooth-bodied texture. Its pale cream color and clean, rounded flavor make it a standout among other cheeses. This cheese is made with sheep's milk and uses vegetarian rennet. It comes in various sizes and weights, making it a versatile choice for any occasion.

process.text: The Somerset Cheese Company follows traditional style recipes to produce Fosseway Fleece. The cheese is carefully prepared by a small team, involved in every step of the process, from milk to finished product. It is then aged to perfection, resulting in a remarkably smooth and creamy texture.

smell_taste.text: Fosseway Fleece has a fresh and clean aroma, with hints of nuttiness. Its flavor is well-balanced, with a mellow tang that lingers on the palate. The cheese has a unique and distinctive taste that is sure to please any cheese lover.

service_suggestions.text: To fully enjoy the flavors of Fosseway Fleece, we recommend serving it at room temperature. This allows the cheese to fully express its rich and complex taste. It can be presented on a cheese board or paired with your favorite crackers. For a perfect pairing, we suggest enjoying this cheese with a glass of red wine or a crisp white wine.

quality_assurance.text: Fosseway Fleece has received numerous accolades and awards, including a silver medal at the British Cheese Awards in 2006 and the World Cheese Awards in 2007. This cheese has been praised for its exceptional quality and taste, making it a must-try for cheese connoisseurs. As the Somerset Cheese Company uses only the highest quality ingredients and follows strict quality standards, you can trust that every bite of Fosseway Fleece will be a delicious and satisfying experience.

slots.Contest: British Cheese Awards, World Cheese Awards

identification.text: Mayfield is a delicious cheese produced by Arthur Alsop and Nic Walker in the heart of East Sussex, England. These highly skilled chefs have a lifelong passion for cheese and have developed some truly unique and distinctive products in their small, modern dairy.

description.text: Mayfield is a semi-hard cheese with a creamy, sweet, and nutty flavor. It is made from full-fat pasteurized cow's milk and has a wax coating. The cheese varies in strength from mild to full, depending on its age, and contains naturally developed oval-shaped holes in its interior.

process.text: Mayfield cheese is made using traditional cheese-making techniques and is aged for 5-7 months. The cheese is carefully prepared and aged to perfection, resulting in its unique and delicious flavor.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of Mayfield cheese is sweet and gentle, with hints of nuttiness. Its texture is smooth and creamy, with evenly spread holes throughout. The taste is rich and creamy, with a perfect balance of sweetness and nuttiness.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Mayfield cheese at room temperature. It can be presented on a cheese board with crackers, fruits, and nuts, or used in various dishes such as grilled cheese sandwiches or salads. Mayfield pairs well with a variety of wines, including Chardonnay and Pinot Noir.

slots.ServeWithDishList: cheese board, crackers, fruits, nuts, grilled cheese sandwiches, salads

quality_assurance.text: Mayfield cheese has received numerous awards, including a gold medal with 3 Stars at the Great Taste Awards, a gold medal at the 2010 British Cheese Awards, and a gold medal at the 2011 World Cheese Awards. These accolades speak to the exceptional quality and taste of this cheese, making it a must-try for all cheese lovers. As our motto says, "Quality is our top priority."

slots.Contest: Great Taste Awards, British Cheese Awards, World Cheese Awards

identification.text: Gorwydd Caerphilly, hand-crafted by Todd Trethown and his team at Gorwydd Farm in the Somerset region of England, has a rich history dating back to its origins in Wales. This traditional cheese has been brought back to life by Todd, who learned the trade from veteran Caerphilly maker Chris Duckett. The cheese is now made by Todd's brother Maughan and his wife Kim, who continue to uphold the traditional recipe.

description.text: Gorwydd Caerphilly is a unique, mature cheese made from raw cow's milk and GM-free animal rennet. Its distinctive shape and size, with a creamy outer layer near the rind and a crumbly, citrus-flavoured centre, make it a stand-out among other cheeses.

process.text: The process of making Gorwydd Caerphilly is truly artisanal, with the curd being worked by hand and the natural mould rind being encouraged to develop. This keeps the cheese true to its traditional origins and results in a stripy interior with a rich, softer texture. The cheese is then aged slowly, allowing its flavours to fully develop.

smell_taste.text: When young, Gorwydd Caerphilly has a fresh, lemony tang. As it ages, the flavours become more intense and complex, with a creamy richness that adds depth to the cheese. The rind can also be enjoyed for a richer experience.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, we recommend serving Gorwydd Caerphilly at room temperature to fully appreciate its flavours and textures. It can be enjoyed on its own or paired with a variety of foods, such as crackers, fruit, or cured meats. For a perfect match, try it with a crisp white wine.

quality_assurance.text: Gorwydd Caerphilly has received numerous awards, including a Gold at the International Cheese Awards Nantwich Show 2017 and Best Territorial Cheese at the 2017 Artisan Cheese Awards. It has also been recognized for its quality by winning Super Gold at the World Cheese Awards and Gold at the British Cheese Awards and Global Cheese Awards. With its rich history and impressive track record, you can trust that Gorwydd Caerphilly is a cheese of the highest quality.

slots.Contest: International Cheese Awards Nantwich Show, World Cheese Awards, British Cheese Awards, Global Cheese Awards

identification.text: Ticklemore, a white rinded goat's milk cheese, is a product of the Sharpham Estate in the Dart Valley, England. This beautiful estate, spanning 500 acres of farmland, is known for its high-quality dairy products. Ticklemore cheese has a rich history, with production dating back to 1981 when it was made in the estate's creamery. In 2003, production was moved to a purpose-built creamery next to the estate's winery, showcasing a blend of traditional techniques and modern facilities.

slots.CheeseCreatorMovedToPlace: purpose-built creamery next to the estate's winery

description.text: Ticklemore cheese is a visually appealing cheese with a distinctive shape and size. It has a smooth and creamy texture, coated with a white rind that adds to its aesthetic appeal. This cheese is made using fresh goat's milk from Button Farm on Dartmoor, where the goats are free-range and a mix of different breeds. The cheese is made using traditional methods and vegetarian rennet, making it suitable for vegetarians.

process.text: Ticklemore cheese is made with great care and attention to detail. The fresh goat's milk is not frozen and is used in the production process. The cheese is made completely by hand, following traditional techniques. After production, the cheese is aged for at least two months, during which time it is carefully nurtured to perfection.

smell_taste.text: Ticklemore cheese has a distinct and alluring aroma, with hints of citrus and a gentle salty undertone. The cheese has a rich and clean flavor, with a creamy lemon tang and a refreshing finish. The taste of Ticklemore cheese is truly unique and will leave you wanting more.

slots.TasteQuality: rich, clean, creamy, lemon tangy, refreshing

service_suggestions.text: To fully enjoy the flavors of Ticklemore cheese, it is best served at room temperature. The cheese can be presented on a cheese board, accompanied by crackers, fruits, and nuts. It pairs well with a variety of foods, including salads, sandwiches, and pasta dishes. For a perfect pairing, serve Ticklemore with a crisp white wine, such as a Sauvignon Blanc or a Pinot Grigio.

slots.ServeWithDishList: crackers, fruits, nuts, salads, sandwiches, pasta dishes

quality_assurance.text: Ticklemore cheese has received recognition for its exceptional quality. It won a Silver Medal at the 2016 British Cheese Awards and a Gold Medal at the Taste of the West in 2015. These awards are a testament to the superior taste and quality of Ticklemore cheese. Additionally, the cheese undergoes rigorous quality tests to ensure that it meets the highest standards, providing you with a truly exceptional cheese experience.

slots.Contest: British Cheese Awards, Taste of the West

identification.text: Introducing the Cheddar Pounder, a masterpiece of cheese-making from Paxton & Whitfield, a renowned cheese manufacturer with a rich history dating back to the 18th century. This cheese hails from the West Country region of England, known for its lush pastures and high-quality dairy products.

description.text: The Cheddar Pounder is a miniature version of the classic cave-aged cheddar, made with pasteurized cow's milk and vegetarian rennet. It is handcrafted and cloth-bound, with a weight of 550g, making it the perfect size for a small gathering or a special treat for yourself.

process.text: This cheese is made using a traditional recipe and is aged in the historic Wookey Hole Caves of Somerset, where it develops a unique complexity and depth of flavor. The caves, with their consistent temperature of 11 degrees Celsius, provide the perfect environment for the cheese to mature for up to three months.

smell_taste.text: The Cheddar Pounder boasts a distinctively fruity and nutty flavor with underlying earthy notes, thanks to its maturation in the caves. Its dense and satisfying consistency makes it a delight to eat, and the lard used to adhere the cloth to the rind gives it a rich and creamy texture.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, we recommend serving this cheese at room temperature, allowing its full flavors to come through. It can be presented on a cheese board with crackers, fruits, and nuts, or used in cooking to add a depth of flavor to your dishes. Pair it with a full-bodied red wine, such as a Cabernet Sauvignon, for a perfect match.

slots.ServeWithDishList: cheese board, crackers, fruits, nuts, cooking dishes

quality_assurance.text: The Cheddar Pounder has earned the prestigious Protected Designation of Origin (PDO) for its adherence to strict specifications regarding its origin, milk source, and recipe. It has also received high praise from cheese experts and has won several awards, making it a cheese of exceptional quality and taste. As our founder, Charles Paxton once said, "The proof of the pudding is in the eating," and we guarantee that you won't be disappointed with this cheese.

identification.text: Introducing the award-winning Cheddar Truckle from Paxton & Whitfield, a renowned cheese manufacturer with a rich history dating back to the heart of Dorset, England. This cheese is made with a traditional recipe using pasteurised milk from local herds and is matured in the historic Wookey Hole Caves of Wells, Somerset, where it gains a distinctive complexity.

description.text: The Cheddar Truckle is a mini cloth bound cheddar with a weight of 1.8kg, making it the perfect size for any occasion. It has a full and fruity flavour, thanks to the use of cow's milk and vegetarian rennet. Please note that while the rennet used is vegetarian, lard is used to adhere the cloth to the rind, making it not suitable for vegetarians.

process.text: The Cheddar Truckle is handmade and aged for up to three months in the unique environment of the Wookey Hole Caves. These caves have existed for millions of years and provide a consistent temperature of 11 degrees Celsius, creating the perfect conditions for maturation. This cheese also holds a coveted Protected Designation of Origin (PDO), ensuring its quality and authenticity.

smell_taste.text: Upon opening, the Cheddar Truckle delights with its distinctively fruity aroma, followed by a nutty bite. As it is aged in the caves, it also has underlying earthy notes, giving it a complex and satisfying taste. Its dense consistency adds to the overall experience of this delicious cheese.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, we recommend serving the Cheddar Truckle at room temperature. Before eating, remove the cloth coating with a knife. This cheese pairs perfectly with crusty bread, crackers, or fresh fruit. For a complete indulgence, pair it with a glass of red wine, such as a full-bodied Cabernet Sauvignon.

quality_assurance.text: Don't just take our word for it, the Cheddar Truckle has received numerous accolades, including a PDO accreditation and being made to exacting specifications. It has also been aged in the historic Wookey Hole Caves, adding to its unique and exceptional flavour. As always, our cheese undergoes rigorous quality testing to ensure the highest standards are met, making it a must-try for any cheese lover.

identification.text:
Colston Bassett Stilton
Colston Bassett Stilton, made by the Colston Bassett Dairy in Nottinghamshire, England, is a classic and award-winning cheese with a rich and buttery flavor. It is named after the village of Stilton, south of Peterborough, where it originated over 100 years ago. Today, due to PDO regulations, it can only be made in Nottinghamshire, Derbyshire, or Leicestershire.

description.text:
Characteristics and Ingredients
This Stilton cheese has a distinct shape and size, with a crumbly texture and a natural rind coating. It weighs 250g and is made from pasteurized cow's milk using traditional rennet.

process.text:
Preparation and Aging
The cheese is made using traditional techniques and is aged for around 12 weeks, reaching perfect maturity. The summer milk used in December gives it its best flavor, making it a traditional Christmas cheese. However, the production and skill have improved, resulting in consistent quality all year round.

smell_taste.text:
4) Description of Smell and Taste
The Stilton has a balanced flavor, with a perfect blend of rich and buttery notes and a slight hint of sharpness from the blue mold. Its aroma is inviting and adds to the overall experience of indulging in this cheese.

service_suggestions.text:
Temperature, Presentation, Food and Wine Pairing
For the best taste, it is recommended to serve the cheese at room temperature, allowing it to rest for a couple of hours after taking it out of the fridge. It can be presented on a cheese board, in salads, or melted on burgers. The classic pairing of Port and Stilton is a must-try, but it also goes well with a variety of wines and can elevate any dish.

quality_assurance.text:
Quotations, Awards, and Quality Tests
Colston Bassett Stilton is a multiple award winner and is widely recognized for its superior quality and taste. It has been praised by cheese experts and is consistently ranked as one of the best Stilton cheeses available. Its production follows strict quality standards, ensuring a consistent and exceptional product every time.

identification.text: Vintage Lincolnshire Poacher by a renowned manufacturer from Lincolnshire, England. This cheese has a rich history and is produced in a specific geographical location known for its high-quality dairy products.

description.text: The Vintage Lincolnshire Poacher is a hard cheese with a unique texture and flavor. It is similar in appearance to Cheddar but has its own distinct characteristics. This cheese is usually matured for 18-22 months, giving it a complex flavor. It is made from unpasteurized Holstein cow's milk, known for its richness. Traditional rennet is used in the production of this cheese.

process.text: The Vintage Lincolnshire Poacher is made using a traditional process, giving it a nod to French mountain cheeses like Comté and Gruyere. The cheese is aged for 18-22 months, allowing it to develop its unique flavor and texture. The farming approach employed in the production adds to the quality of this cheese.

smell_taste.text: This cheese has a smooth and fruity aroma with an earthy nuttiness near the rind. The aging process gives it a complex and rich flavor, with hints of Comté and Gruyere. The taste is a perfect balance of sweet and savory, making it a delight for cheese lovers.

service_suggestions.text: The Vintage Lincolnshire Poacher can be enjoyed in various ways. It is best served at room temperature, allowing the flavors to fully develop. This cheese can be served on a cheeseboard, as part of a Ploughman's Lunch, or in a toastie with cooked ham and mustard. It pairs well with a variety of foods, adding a rich and flavorful touch to any dish. For a complete experience, pair it with a glass of red wine.

slots.ServeWithDishList: cheeseboard, Ploughman's Lunch, toastie with cooked ham and mustard

quality_assurance.text: The Vintage Lincolnshire Poacher has received rave reviews from cheese enthusiasts and experts alike. It has won numerous awards for its exceptional quality and taste. The cheese undergoes strict quality tests to ensure that every piece meets the highest standards. As one satisfied customer puts it, "The Vintage Lincolnshire Poacher is a stunning cheese that adds a beautiful and rich flavor to any dish."

identification.text: Beauvale by Cropwell Bishop - A Delicious Combination of Stilton and Gorgonzola from the Peak District

description.text: This award-winning blue cheese is handcrafted with traditional rennet and British milk from the Peak District. It boasts a rich, buttery flavor of Stilton and a soft, spreadable texture of Gorgonzola, with a subtle sweetness from its Italian counterpart. Beauvale is matured for seven weeks, developing an edible rind, and should be stored between 2-5 degrees before being brought to room temperature for optimal taste.

process.text: Beauvale is hand ladled and carefully aged for seven weeks, allowing its flavors to fully develop. Traditional rennet is used to bring out the smooth, creamy texture and mellow flavor of this unique cheese.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of Beauvale is both rich and inviting, with hints of butter and sweetness. Upon tasting, you will experience a creamy, buttery texture with a subtle sweetness and a tangy finish.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Beauvale at room temperature to showcase its soft, creamy, and spreadable qualities. It pairs perfectly with a variety of foods, such as salads, crusty bread, figs, and honey. For a complete indulgence, pair Beauvale with a glass of your favorite wine.

quality_assurance.text: Beauvale has been recognized as the 'Best Blue Cheese' at the British Cheese Awards 2017. It is made with the highest quality ingredients and handcrafted with precision, ensuring a delicious and unique cheese that is truly worth trying. As one satisfied customer puts it, "Beauvale is really worth a try as words don't do it justice."

identification.text:
Baron Bigod by Fen Farm, Suffolk, England
Baron Bigod is a traditional raw milk, farmhouse brie made by Jonny and Dulcie Crickmore at Fen Farm in Bungay, Suffolk. It is one of the few remaining farmhouse bries in the world and the only one in the UK. With its rich history and geographical provenance, Baron Bigod is a true gem among cheeses.

description.text:
Silky smooth texture, earthy and mushroom flavors, 250g weight
Baron Bigod is known for its silky smooth texture and delicious earthy and mushroom flavors. When ripe, the rind has a slight brownish marbling, which is a desirable feature as it indicates a gooey and spreadable interior. This cheese is made from the raw milk of Fen Farm's own Montbeliarde cows, giving it a unique and rich taste. It weighs 250g, making it the perfect size for sharing or indulging on your own.

process.text:
Traditional preparation and aging
Baron Bigod is made using traditional methods, ensuring the highest quality and authentic taste. The milk from the Montbeliarde cows is prized among cheesemakers around the world for its perfect cheesemaking properties. The cheese is then aged to perfection, allowing the flavors to develop and intensify.

smell_taste.text:
Earthy, mushroom, and creamy
The aroma of Baron Bigod is earthy and mushroom-like, with a hint of creaminess. The taste is rich and creamy, with a subtle tanginess that lingers on the palate. The combination of flavors makes this cheese a true delight for the senses.

service_suggestions.text:
Best served at room temperature, pairs well with crackers and chilli jam
For the best experience, serve Baron Bigod at room temperature. This allows the cheese to reach its full potential, with its flavors and textures at their peak. It pairs perfectly with Millers Elements Fire crackers for a spicy kick, or Millers Damsels Buttermilk for a milder option. For a delicious lunch, try it in a toastie with chorizo and a nice chilli jam. And for a royal touch, enjoy it just like Harry and Meghan did at their wedding breakfast.

quality_assurance.text:
"Brie of choice" at our café and shop, highly acclaimed
Baron Bigod is our brie of choice at our café and shop, and for good reason. It has received high praise and recognition, including being part of Harry and Meghan's wedding breakfast. It is also not recommended to eat during pregnancy, further emphasizing its exceptional quality. With its rich history, traditional preparation, and delicious taste, Baron Bigod is a must-try for all cheese lovers.

identification.text:
A Deliciously Unique Creation by Cheesemongers Choice
Originating from the stunning Isle of Wight in the United Kingdom, this award-winning cheese has been delighting taste buds since its creation in 2006. Made with love and care by Cheesemongers Choice, this cheese is a true masterpiece of flavor and craftsmanship.

description.text:
Characteristics and Ingredients of Isle of Wight Blue
Isle of Wight Blue is a naturally rinded soft cheese with a mild blue flavor that intensifies as it matures. Its beautiful green, blue, and grey mold coating adds to the character of the cheese, both in appearance and taste. Each 210g piece is made with traditional rennet and pasteurized cow's milk, ensuring a high-quality and delicious product.

process.text:
The Process of Preparing and Aging Isle of Wight Blue
Our expert cheesemakers take great care in the preparation and aging of Isle of Wight Blue. Each cheese is carefully crafted and aged to perfection, allowing its flavors to develop and mature over time. The result is a cheese that is bursting with flavor and a delight to the senses.

smell_taste.text:
The Smell and Taste of Isle of Wight Blue
The aroma of Isle of Wight Blue is rich and inviting, with hints of earthy and nutty notes. As for its taste, this cheese starts off with a mild blue flavor that gradually builds into a bold and flavorful punch. Its creamy and smooth texture adds to the overall sensory experience, making it a cheese-lover's dream.

service_suggestions.text:
Serving Suggestions for Isle of Wight Blue
To truly appreciate the flavors of Isle of Wight Blue, we recommend serving it at room temperature. This allows the cheese to reach its full potential, with its creamy and tangy flavors shining through. For presentation, the sporadic blue patches on the yellow cheese make for a beautiful addition to any cheeseboard. As for food and wine pairing, this cheese pairs perfectly with a nice porter or stout, or even a slightly sweet wine.

quality_assurance.text:
Quotations, Awards, and Quality Tests
Don't just take our word for it - Isle of Wight Blue has been praised by celebrity chefs and has won multiple awards for its exceptional taste and quality. Its popularity is ever-growing, with constant increases in demand. Rest assured, each piece of Isle of Wight Blue has been carefully tested and meets our high standards of quality and excellence. Try it for yourself and see why it's our most popular cheese online.

identification.text: Westcombe Cheddar is a hand-crafted cheddar from Evercreech, Somerset, made with unpasteurised cows milk from Lower Westcombe Farm. It has been the winner of 'Best Cheddar' at the 2018 British Cheese Awards and holds European PDO status as well as Artisan Somerset Cheddar designation from Slow Food.

description.text: This traditional cheddar has a deep, nutty flavor with citrusy, grassy notes and a lovely long, lingering finish with hints of caramel. It weighs 250g and is made with unpasteurised cow's milk using traditional rennet.

process.text: Westcombe Cheddar is hand-crafted and aged to perfection. The cheese is made using traditional methods and is carefully aged to develop its rich, complex flavors.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of Westcombe Cheddar is reminiscent of hazelnuts, while the taste is full of deep, nutty flavors with hints of citrus and grass. The cheese has a lovely long finish with subtle caramel notes.

slots.TasteQuality: Full of deep, nutty flavors with hints of citrus and grass
slots.AfterTaste: Lovely long finish with subtle caramel notes

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Westcombe Cheddar at room temperature. It can be enjoyed on a cheeseboard or as part of a classic Ploughman's Lunch. This versatile cheese pairs well with many beers, but a pale ale is recommended for the perfect pairing.

quality_assurance.text: "This is a cheddar that has won practically all awards going" and is highly praised by cheese experts. It holds European PDO status and has been designated as an Artisan Somerset Cheddar by Slow Food. These honors are a testament to the quality and excellence of Westcombe Cheddar.

identification.text: Introducing the award-winning Strathearn cheese, crafted by the renowned cheese maker in Perthshire, Scotland. This semi-soft cow's milk cheese is a true representation of the innovation and quality present in the British cheese industry.

description.text: Strathearn is a 250g cheese with a unique shape and size, perfect for any cheese platter. Its texture is both creamy and lactic, with a pungent and flavorsome rind. Made with pasteurized cow's milk and vegetarian rennet, this cheese is suitable for all cheese lovers.

process.text: To create this exceptional cheese, the cheese is matured for 4 weeks and washed every two days in brine containing Glenturret 10 year old single malt whisky. This process results in a cheese with a sweet and lactic paste, perfectly balanced with the pungent and flavorful rind.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of Strathearn cheese is a delight to the senses, with hints of whisky and a creamy, milky scent. The taste is equally impressive, with a perfect balance of sweetness and tanginess, leaving a lasting impression on your taste buds.

service_suggestions.text: For the ultimate cheese experience, we recommend serving Strathearn at room temperature to allow the flavors to fully develop. Pair it with oatcakes and a single malt whisky for a perfect combination of flavors. This cheese also pairs well with a variety of wines, such as a crisp Sauvignon Blanc or a bold Cabernet Sauvignon.

quality_assurance.text: Don't just take our word for it - Strathearn has received numerous accolades, including a Gold Medal at the World Cheese Awards in 2016. The quality and unique flavor of this cheese have been recognized by cheese experts and enthusiasts alike. Try it for yourself and taste the award-winning goodness of Strathearn cheese.

identification.text: Perl Las, made by Caws Cenarth of Cardigan in West Wales, is a blue cheese that truly lives up to its name, which means 'blue pearl'. This cheese has a rich history, with production starting in 1987 as a means to diversify their farm business away from just milk. Today, Caws Cenarth is known for producing a range of magnificent Welsh cheeses.

description.text: Perl Las is a hand-made cheese with a unique twist. Instead of being dipped in brine like many other cheeses, the rind is rubbed with local sea salt, giving it a subtler saltiness. The paste has a light golden color and is beautifully marbled with blue veins. Each wheel weighs 250g and is made with pasteurized cow's milk, making it suitable for vegetarians. The rennet used is vegetarian, ensuring that every bite is ethically produced.

process.text: The production of Perl Las involves a meticulous process of hand-making and aging. The cheese is carefully crafted to ensure a perfect balance of flavors. The aging process takes place in a controlled environment, allowing the cheese to develop its unique taste and texture.

smell_taste.text: Perl Las has a delicate and refined flavor, making it a great introductory cheese for those who may not be keen on blue cheese. The flavors are gentle yet satisfying, with a subtle sweetness that can grow as the cheese matures. Its aroma is enticing, with a hint of saltiness that is not overpowering.

service_suggestions.text: To truly appreciate the flavors of Perl Las, serve it at room temperature with some crusty bread and a dollop of fig jam. The sweetness of the jam perfectly complements the light sweetness of the cheese. For a complete experience, pair it with a sweet stout or a glass of port. The cheese also makes a great addition to any cheese board or as a topping for salads or pasta dishes.

quality_assurance.text: Perl Las has received numerous accolades, including featuring in our 'Most Popular Cheese Selection' box, which is a cheese hamper of our most popular cheeses. The cheese is also made with pasteurized milk, ensuring the highest quality and safety standards. It is suitable for vegetarians and has been awarded for its exceptional taste and quality. As one satisfied customer raves, "The sweetness of Perl Las is quite addictive and once you start eating, it's difficult to stop."

identification.text: Introducing Little Wallop, a delectable goat's cheese from the renowned cheesemakers, White Lake Cheeses in Somerset, United Kingdom. This cheese is part of the 'Alex James Presents...' range, curated by the famous musician and cheese enthusiast. With its rich history and geographical provenance, Little Wallop is a must-try for any cheese lover.

description.text: This cheese is a true work of art, both in appearance and taste. Encased in a vine leaf, Little Wallop boasts a strong, nutty, and tangy flavor, thanks to being washed in Somerset brandy cider. Its silky texture and weight of 140g make it a perfect addition to any cheeseboard. Made with pasteurized goat's milk and vegetarian rennet, this cheese is suitable for all palates.

process.text: The expert cheesemakers at White Lake Cheeses have perfected the art of creating Little Wallop. The cheese is carefully prepared and aged to develop its unique flavor profile. As it matures, it acquires a soft, oozing texture that is sure to tantalize your taste buds.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of Little Wallop is as enticing as its taste. The vine leaf adds a subtle earthy note to the cheese, while the Somerset brandy cider wash infuses it with a distinct tanginess. The result is a well-balanced and flavorful cheese that is sure to leave a lasting impression.

slots.AromaQuality: enticing, subtle earthy note, distinct tanginess

service_suggestions.text: For the ultimate cheese experience, we recommend serving Little Wallop at room temperature. The vine leaf adds to the cheese's aesthetic appeal, making it a beautiful addition to any cheeseboard. Pair it with a light Somerset cider for a refreshing combination, or opt for a chilled Chablis for a more sophisticated taste. If you prefer beer, we suggest trying it with a session IPA like High Wire by Magic Rock or Neck Oil by Beavertown.

slots.ServeWithDishList: cheeseboard, cider, Chablis, beer, session IPA

quality_assurance.text: Don't just take our word for it, Little Wallop has received numerous accolades and recognition for its exceptional taste and quality. As part of the 'Alex James Presents...' range, this cheese has been curated by a renowned cheese connoisseur. With its use of vegetarian rennet and pasteurized goat's milk, Little Wallop is also suitable for vegetarians. So go ahead and indulge in this award-winning cheese with confidence.

identification.text: Cerney Ash is a delicious goats cheese produced by the renowned manufacturer in Cerney, Gloucestershire. With a long history of cheese-making in this region, Cerney Ash is a true representation of the traditional and high-quality cheeses produced in this area.

description.text: This award-winning cheese is shaped in a truncated pyramid, similar to the famous Valencay cheese. Coated in a mix of oak ash and sea salt, Cerney Ash is not just visually appealing but also serves as a protective layer for its light and delicate texture. Weighing in at 250g, this cheese is made from unpasteurised goat milk and uses vegetarian rennet.

slots.CheeseProductIngredientToMilkColor: mix of oak ash and sea salt

process.text: Cerney Ash is prepared with great care and attention to detail. The cheese is aged to perfection, allowing its flavours to develop and mature. The result is a cheese that is light and mild when young, but as it ages, it becomes nuttier and more robust in taste.

smell_taste.text: With its light, citrus tang and mousse-like texture, Cerney Ash is a truly unique cheese. The goat flavour is present but not overpowering, making it a perfect choice for those who may not typically enjoy goat cheese. As it matures, the cheese develops a nutty taste that adds depth to its already delicious flavour profile.

service_suggestions.text: To fully appreciate the flavours of Cerney Ash, we recommend serving it at room temperature. The cheese can be presented on a cheese board with other delicate flavours and pairs well with pilsner or a light summery cider. It can also be used in cooking, adding a creamy richness to salads. One of our favourite recipes is to have it on fried aubergine slices and drizzled with honey.

slots.ServeWithDishList: cheese board, salads, fried aubergine slices

quality_assurance.text: Cerney Ash is a multiple award-winning cheese, including being named 'Best Goat Cheese' at the 2015 World Cheese Awards. Its shape and size are perfect for any cheeseboard, and its wax coating ensures that it stays fresh and delicious. Each piece weighs 250g and is made with vegetarian rennet, making it suitable for all cheese lovers.

process.text: The Ribblesdale Superior Goat Cheese is carefully prepared using traditional methods, and aged to perfection to achieve its distinctive taste and texture. The cheese benefits from the natural pastures and high rainfall of the Yorkshire Dales, resulting in a truly exceptional product.

identification.text: Suffolk Gold by Creeting St Mary is a semi-hard British cheese with a rich history and geographical provenance. Made in Suffolk, this cheese is a true representation of the region's traditional dairy farming.

description.text: This semi-hard cheese is made using milk from the farm's own Guernsey cows, known for their creamy and buttery flavor. The cheese has a mild sweetness and a golden hue, thanks to the high butterfat content. It weighs 250g and is suitable for vegetarians, making it a guilt-free indulgence.

process.text: Suffolk Gold cheese is prepared using traditional methods and aged to perfection. The result is a smooth and creamy texture, with hints of Caerphilly and a rind reminiscent of St Nectaire. The cheese's attractive rind and color make it a feast for the eyes as well.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of Suffolk Gold cheese is inviting, with a hint of butter and cream. Its taste is similar to cheddar, but with a softer texture and a mild sweetness. This cheese is a perfect balance of flavors and is sure to please any palate.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Suffolk Gold cheese at room temperature. Its creamy texture and rich flavor make it a perfect addition to a cheese platter. Pair it with oatcakes and an apple for a delicious snack. And for the ultimate combination, we recommend pairing it with a red ale like Rapture by Magic Rock Brewery.

quality_assurance.text: Suffolk Gold cheese is made with the highest quality ingredients and is safe to eat while pregnant. It has also received numerous awards and accolades, making it a must-try for all cheese lovers. As one satisfied customer puts it, "An altogether pleasing cheese with its attractive rind and mix of flavors." Give Suffolk Gold a try and taste the difference for yourself.

identification.text:
A Taste of Award-Winning Excellence from Kent, England
Winterdale Shaw cheese is a true masterpiece created by the skilled hands of Robin and Carla Betts at their family farm in Fairseat, Kent. With a rich historical and geographical provenance, this cheese has been in production since 2006 and has gained recognition from none other than Prince Charles himself.

description.text:
Winterdale Shaw Cheese
Crafted in small batches using unpasteurized cow's milk and vegetarian rennet, Winterdale Shaw cheese is formed into 10kg truckles, cloth-wrapped, and matured for a minimum of 9 months. This results in a unique shape, size, and texture that is loved by cheese connoisseurs all over the world.

slots.CheeseProductRind: Cloth-wrapped and matured for a minimum of 9 months

process.text:
The Art of Making Winterdale Shaw Cheese
Winterdale Shaw cheese is made with love and care, using traditional techniques passed down through generations. The cheese is aged in a natural environment, allowing it to develop its distinct flavors and characteristics. The use of renewable energy sources such as solar panels and ground source heat pumps also makes it the UK's first carbon-neutral cheese.

smell_taste.text:
Winterdale Shaw Cheese
Winterdale Shaw cheese is a true delight for the senses. Its clean, lemony, and nutty aroma entices you from the first bite. The tangy and complex flavors keep evolving, leaving a long-lasting impression on your taste buds. Not too strong, yet not too mild, this cheese strikes the perfect balance.

service_suggestions.text:
Winterdale Shaw Cheese Serving Suggestions
To truly appreciate the flavors of Winterdale Shaw cheese, it is best served at room temperature. Its unique texture and taste make it a great addition to any cheese platter. It also adds a twist to classic dishes like Welsh Rarebit. Pair it with a glass of your favorite wine for a truly indulgent experience.

quality_assurance.text:
Winterdale Shaw Cheese
Winterdale Shaw cheese has been recognized as a multiple award winner, making it a true testament to its exceptional quality. It has also been praised by Prince Charles himself. With every bite, you can be sure that you are indulging in a cheese that has passed rigorous quality tests and is loved by cheese lovers worldwide.

identification.text: Rainbow's Gold is a unique, unpasteurised cheese from Somerset, England. It is made by Phil Rainbow of the Somerset Cheese Company, using traditional methods and locally sourced ingredients. With a rich history and geographical provenance, this cheese is a true representation of the Somerset region.

description.text: Rainbow's Gold is a cheddar-style cheese with a twist. It is washed in 'Golden Chalice' ale from Glastonbury, giving it a softer, stickier texture. This 250g cheese has a crumbly yet melt-in-your-mouth texture, with a surprisingly strong flavor of grassy, farmyard notes. It is made with unpasteurised cow's milk and vegetarian rennet, making it suitable for vegetarians.

process.text: Rainbow's Gold is made using traditional methods and aged to perfection. The cheddar-style cheese is washed in 'Golden Chalice' ale, which gives it a unique flavor and texture. It is then aged to develop its rich and complex taste, making it a truly special cheese.

smell_taste.text: The unique process of washing Rainbow's Gold in 'Golden Chalice' ale gives it a distinctive aroma, with hints of grassy and farmyard notes. The taste is surprisingly strong, with a perfect balance of flavors that lingers on the palate. It has a crumbly texture that melts in your mouth, making it a delight to eat.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, we recommend serving Rainbow's Gold at room temperature. It can be presented on a cheeseboard or paired with other complementary flavors such as fruits, nuts, and crackers. For a perfect pairing, we suggest trying it with a hoppy beer like 'Madness IPA' by the Wild Beer Co or a strong Belgian-style beer like Troubador Obscura or Troubador Magma.

slots.ComplementaryWines: Madness IPA by the Wild Beer Co, Troubador Obscura, Troubador Magma

It has also received numerous awards and accolades, solidifying its position as a top-quality cheese. Made with unpasteurised milk and vegetarian rennet, you can trust in the quality and authenticity of Rainbow's Gold.

identification.text: Pavé Cobble by White Lake Cheeses from Somerset, United Kingdom. This award-winning cheese has a rich history and is known for its exceptional quality and taste.

description.text: Pavé Cobble is a soft, pyramid-shaped cheese made from ewe's milk. Each cheese is hand-ladled and dusted with charcoal before being matured for three weeks. It has a velvety rind and a soft, silky paste that oozes out when perfectly ripe. The weight of each cheese is 200g.

process.text: Pavé Cobble follows traditional cheesemaking methods, ensuring the highest quality and taste. The cheese is carefully prepared and aged for three weeks, allowing it to develop its unique flavor and texture.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of Pavé Cobble is rich and creamy, with hints of earthy notes. Its taste is equally delightful, with a smooth and buttery flavor that melts in your mouth. The texture is soft and creamy, making it a perfect choice for cheese lovers.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Pavé Cobble at room temperature, allowing its flavors to fully develop. This cheese pairs perfectly with light crackers and a chilled glass of white wine or a light Somerset cider. Its delicate flavor also makes it a great addition to any cheese platter.

quality_assurance.text: Pavé Cobble has received numerous awards, including the prestigious British Cheese Awards Supreme Champion 2017. Its quality is also assured by the use of vegetarian rennet and pasteurized milk. As quoted by the manufacturer, "Pavé Cobble is proof of our expertise in making both goat's milk and ewe's milk cheese." Trust in the quality and taste of Pavé Cobble, a true champion in the world of cheese.

identification.text: Introducing the award-winning Black Bomber, a creamy and smooth extra mature Cheddar from the renowned manufacturer, Little Black Bomber. This modern classic hails from the heart of Wales, where Cheddars have been crafted for centuries.

description.text: The Black Bomber is a 200g or 400g truckle, or a 3kg wheel, making it perfect for any occasion. Its texture is smooth and creamy, with a rich depth of flavor that lingers on the palate. Made from the highest quality milk and traditional rennet, this cheese is a true testament to its Welsh heritage.

process.text: Crafted with care, the Black Bomber is prepared using traditional methods and aged to perfection. This process brings out the cheese's full flavor and creates a smooth, creamy texture that is simply irresistible.

smell_taste.text: Upon opening, the Black Bomber releases a rich and enticing aroma that will have your mouth watering. Its taste is bold and complex, with a creamy and smooth finish that leaves you wanting more. This cheese is truly demandingly moreish.

service_suggestions.text: For the ultimate Black Bomber experience, serve at room temperature with fresh crusty bread and a quality chutney or relish. This cheese pairs perfectly with a Cabernet Sauvignon or Chardonnay, enhancing its flavors and creating a truly indulgent experience.

quality_assurance.text: Don't just take our word for it, the Black Bomber has won numerous awards at prestigious events such as The Great British Cheese Awards, Nantwich International Cheese Awards, and the World Cheese Awards. It even received a Super Gold at Mondial Fromage in France. These accolades are a testament to the quality and excellence of this cheese. Try it for yourself and taste the difference.

identification.text:
A Taste of Tradition from Caws Teifi in the Teifi Valley
Celtic Promise is a raw-milk washed-rind cheese with a rich history and a distinct geographical provenance. Crafted by John Savage-Onstwedder on his organic family farm in the Teifi Valley, this cheese is a true representation of traditional cheese-making methods.

description.text: rind cheese weighs 550g and is coated with a moist pink rind, giving it a unique and eye-catching appearance. Made from organic, unpasteurized cow's milk and using traditional rennet, this cheese is a testament to the quality of its ingredients.

process.text:
From Caws Teifi Caerphilly to Moist Pink Rind
The process of making Celtic Promise is a labor of love. Starting as a Caws Teifi Caerphilly, the cheese is then washed with cider twice a week for seven weeks. This careful and meticulous process allows the cheese to develop its moist pink rind, giving it its distinctive appearance and flavor.

smell_taste.text:
Delicate Smell and Bold Taste
Celtic Promise is a cheese that appeals to all senses. Its delicate smell and bold taste make it a true delight for cheese lovers. The pungent aroma is balanced by the buttery texture, creating a perfect harmony of flavors.

service_suggestions.text:
Serving Suggestions for the Ultimate Experience
For the best experience, we recommend serving Celtic Promise at room temperature to allow the flavors to fully develop. Its unique appearance also makes it a great addition to any cheese board. Pair it with crackers, fruits, and nuts for a delicious snack or serve it with a glass of dry cider or a full-bodied red wine for a perfect pairing.

quality_assurance.text:
A Testimony to Excellence
Celtic Promise has received numerous awards over the years, including the prestigious title of Supreme Champion twice at the British Cheese Awards. It is also one of only six British cheeses to have been awarded a 3-star Great Taste Award in 2018. These recognitions are a testament to the exceptional quality and taste of this cheese, making it a must-try for any cheese connoisseur.

slots.Contest: British Cheese Awards, Great Taste Award

identification.text: Red Leicester, crafted by master cheesemakers at Arla's traditional Taw Valley creamery in Devon, England.

description.text: This true English classic cheese boasts a distinctive russet red color, satisfyingly firm texture, and a weight of [insert weight]. It is made from fresh, quality milk that is gently pasteurized and combined with starter cultures and vegetarian rennet to produce curds. The addition of annatto, a natural food coloring extracted from the South American Achiote tree, gives Red Leicester its unique red-orange tone.

slots.CheeseProductIngredients: Milk, starter cultures, vegetarian rennet, annatto

process.text: The time-honoured recipe involves sourcing fresh quality milk, gently pasteurizing it, and placing it into cheese vats. Starter cultures and vegetarian rennet are added to produce curds, which are then separated from the whey and milled. Salt is added to slow the process and act as a preservative and flavor enhancer. The cheese is then aged to perfection.

smell_taste.text: Red Leicester has a savory and slightly sweet taste with subtle nutty notes. Its aroma is rich and inviting, making it a favorite among cheese connoisseurs.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Red Leicester at room temperature to allow its flavors to fully develop. Its striking red-orange color makes for a beautiful addition to any cheeseboard. It pairs well with a variety of foods, from crackers and bread to sauces and soups. For a perfect pairing, enjoy it with a glass of [insert recommended wine].

quality_assurance.text: The expert graders at Taw Valley use their skill to ensure each cheese boasts a beautiful even red hue with an open, rugged texture. Its quality has been recognized with numerous awards and accolades, making it a top choice among cheese lovers. As one satisfied customer put it, "Red Leicester from Arla's Taw Valley creamery is simply the best cheese I've ever tasted."

identification.text: Discover the taste of Cornwall with Arla's award-winning white cheeses. Made at their traditional Trevarrian creamery nestled in the north Cornish coastline, these cheeses are a true taste of the region.

description.text: Arla's white cheeses, including Cornish Camembert, Brie, and Goat's Cheese, are beautifully soft and creamy. They come in various shapes and sizes, with a distinctively soft and silky texture and a smooth, creamy mouthfeel. Made with the sweetest Cornish milk enriched with just the right amount of cream, these cheeses are a true delight.

process.text: Using time-honoured techniques, the master cheesemakers at Arla's Trevarrian creamery carefully prepare and age their white cheeses. The result? Award-winning soft cheeses with complex flavors and a subtle earthy aroma.

smell_taste.text: Indulge in the mild, buttery flavor of Cornish Brie, with a hint of sharpness and clean mushroom notes. Or try the distinctive Gevrik, a mold-ripened soft goat's cheese with a pure white creamy center and a delicately mild flavor with a nutty hint and savory edge. And for those who enjoy a more robust flavor, the mold-ripened Cornish Camembert is a must-try, with its complex flavors and subtle earthy aroma.

slots.TasteQualityList: mild, buttery, sharp, clean, mushroom, distinctive, pure white, creamy, delicately mild, nutty, savory, robust, complex, subtle, earthy

identification.text: Stilton, handcrafted by Arla's Tuxford & Tebbutt creamery in Melton Mowbray, England since 1780. It is known as the 'King of English Cheese' and is one of only six creameries in the world permitted to make Blue Stilton.

description.text: Stilton is a rich, creamy cheese with a rounded, complex flavor and a piquant finish. It is traditionally produced in open vats using pasteurized milk and is salted and milled into hoops. It is then aged in maturing stores and individually graded by hand to create the perfect Stilton. It is made using milk exclusively farmed from Leicestershire, Nottinghamshire, and Derbyshire.

process.text: Stilton is made using traditional methods, with the cheese being turned for around five days before being transferred to the maturing stores. Here, it is aged and graded by hand at regular intervals to ensure the highest quality.

smell_taste.text: Stilton has a strong, creamy aroma and a satisfyingly rich taste. It has a smooth, creamy mouthfeel and a tangy finish that makes it a favorite among cheese lovers.

service_suggestions.text: To fully enjoy the flavor of Stilton, it is best to let it reach room temperature before serving. It pairs well with crackers, fruits, and a glass of port. It can also be used in cooking to add a smooth, tangy richness to soups, sauces, and salads.

slots.ListofUses: cooking, adding richness to soups, sauces, salads

quality_assurance.text: Stilton has been celebrated for centuries and has acquired Protected Designation Origin status, ensuring that it can only be made in Leicestershire, Nottinghamshire, and Derbyshire. It has also been awarded numerous awards and is highly praised by cheese lovers, as seen in the 19th century saying from the village of Wymondham: "Drink a pot of ale, eat a scoop of Stilton, every day, you will make 'old bones'." With its rich history and high quality, Stilton is a cheese that can be enjoyed with confidence.

identification.text: Shropshire Blue, made by Tuxford & Tebbutt creamery, is a full-bodied and high quality cheese with a rich history. Originally created in the 1970s at Castle Stuart dairy in Inverness, it was marketed as Shropshire Blue despite having no links to the region. Today, it is commonly produced in the East Midlands alongside its cousin, Stilton.

description.text: This cheese is known for its strong nutty flavor and delightfully smooth and creamy texture. It is made using pasteurized milk and is salted and milled into hoops before being transferred to maturing stores. The cheese is also distinguished by its rich orange color, created by the addition of natural food coloring called Annatto. It comes in a variety of sizes and weights, making it a versatile option for any occasion.

process.text: Shropshire Blue is made in a similar process to Stilton, with expert cheesemakers carefully adding the exact quantities of ingredients to perfect its unique flavor and texture. The cheese is then aged to allow the flavors to fully develop, resulting in a rich and complex taste.

smell_taste.text: The cheese has a strong and distinct aroma, with hints of nuttiness and a slight tang. Its taste is robust and creamy, with a perfect balance of savory and tangy flavors. The delicate blue veins add a beautiful contrast to the rich orange color, making it a feast for the eyes as well as the palate.

slots.AromaQuality: Strong and distinct, nutty, slight tang

service_suggestions.text: To fully enjoy the flavors of Shropshire Blue, it is best served at room temperature. It can be presented on a cheese board or crumbled over salads and pasta dishes. This versatile cheese pairs well with a variety of foods, including fruits, nuts, and cured meats. For a truly indulgent experience, pair it with a full-bodied red wine or a crisp white wine.

slots.ComplementaryWines: full-bodied red wine, crisp white wine

quality_assurance.text: Shropshire Blue has received numerous accolades and awards, including being made alongside its famous cousin, Stilton, at the Tuxford & Tebbutt creamery. Our expert cheesemakers are dedicated to ensuring the highest quality and consistency in every batch. As one satisfied customer puts it, "Shropshire Blue is the perfect blend of flavor and texture, making it a must-try for all cheese lovers."

identification.text: Our award-winning Thick and Creamy Cottage Cheese is made at our high tech Stourton creamery. This delicious cheese has a rich history as a farmhouse cheese and its quick fermentation process means it can be enjoyed straight away without maturing. It is proudly made in Stourton, a small town known for its traditional cheese-making techniques.

description.text: Our Cottage Cheese is known for its thick and creamy texture, with a generous silky dressing and melting texture. It comes in a variety of flavors including natural, pineapple, onion and chive, and sweet chilli. Each version is carefully crafted using the highest quality ingredients, including fresh milk and rennet.

process.text: Our Cottage Cheese is made using a traditional farmhouse recipe, passed down through generations. The curds are carefully prepared and aged to ensure a defined and chunky texture that is easily recognizable. Our cheese is made with love and care, resulting in a product that is truly special.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of our Cottage Cheese is fresh and inviting, with hints of cream and tangy cheese. When you take a bite, you'll experience a burst of flavors that are both rich and delicate. The cheese has a moist and crumbly texture that melts in your mouth, leaving a satisfying and lingering taste.

service_suggestions.text: Our Cottage Cheese is best enjoyed chilled, served with crackers for a quick and delicious snack. It's also perfect for picnics or meals on the go. For a more formal presentation, try adding a dollop of our Cottage Cheese to a jacket potato or salad. It pairs perfectly with a crisp white wine or a light and fruity red.

slots.ComplementaryWines: crisp white wine, light and fruity red

quality_assurance.text: Our Cottage Cheese has received numerous national and international awards, making it a trusted and reputable brand. Karen Betton, master cheesemaker from Stourton creamery, has praised our cheese for its defined curds and superior taste. We take great pride in our quality testing process, ensuring that each batch of Cottage Cheese meets our high standards. Try it for yourself and taste the difference!

identification.text: Hafod Welsh Organic Cheddar is a traditional hard cheese handmade by Bwlchwernen Fawr, the longest certified organic dairy farm in Wales. The name "Hafod" (pronounced Havod) means "summer place" or "pasture" in Welsh, reflecting the farm's location next to the river Aeron where the cows graze.

description.text: Hafod is made using only raw (unpasteurised) milk from 75 Ayrshire cows, known for their rich butterfat and protein content. This unique combination of organic Ayrshire milk and traditional cheesemaking techniques results in a buttery, rich and nutty flavor. The cheese is typically sold in blocks and weighs approximately 200g.

process.text: The cheesemaking process at Bwlchwernen Fawr has been passed down for over 40 years and is overseen by Patrick Holden, CEO of the Sustainable Food Trust. The milk is heated and mixed with rennet, then left to curdle before being cut into small pieces. The curds are then pressed and aged for a minimum of 16 months, giving Hafod its distinct flavor and texture.

smell_taste.text: Hafod has a distinct, earthy aroma with hints of nuttiness. The taste is rich and buttery, with a slight tang and a lingering nutty finish. The texture is firm yet creamy, with a slight crumble.

service_suggestions.text: To fully enjoy the flavors and textures of Hafod, it is best served at room temperature. Cut into thin slices and serve on a cheese board with crackers or crusty bread. Hafod pairs well with fruits such as apples and pears, as well as cured meats like prosciutto. For a perfect pairing, try it with a full-bodied red wine such as a Cabernet Sauvignon.

slots.ServeWithDishList: crackers, crusty bread, fruits (apples, pears), cured meats (prosciutto)

quality_assurance.text: Hafod has received numerous accolades, including being named "Best Traditional Cheddar" at the British Cheese Awards. It has also been praised by renowned chefs and food critics for its exceptional flavor and quality. Bwlchwernen Fawr takes great pride in their organic and sustainable farming practices, ensuring the highest quality of milk and cheese production.

identification.text: Renegade Monk is a unique and daring cheese made by Marcus Fergusson at Felthams Farm. Inspired by Continental cheeses, this cheese breaks tradition and stands out as a renegade in the British cheese scene. The name also pays homage to the Knights Templar, adding a touch of mystery and intrigue. Felthams Farm is located near Templecombe, where a Templar Preceptory was established in 1185.

description.text: Renegade Monk is made from organic, pasteurised cows’ milk and hand-washed in ale every few days as it matures. This results in a hybrid cheese, combining the attributes of soft white cheese, blue cheese, and rind-washed cheese. The cheese comes in a variety of shapes and sizes, with a firmer rind and a milder interior when aged, and a softer, almost liquid texture when encouraged. The cheese is coated in a pale rind with a scatter of blue, and has a pungent, goaty inner core. The weight of the cheese varies depending on the stage of maturity.

slots.CheeseProductColor: Pale with a scatter of blue
slots.CheeseProductInteriorColor: Milder interior when aged, softer and almost liquid when encouraged
slots.CheeseProductPackWeight: Varies depending on stage of maturity

process.text: Renegade Monk is carefully crafted by Marcus Fergusson using milk from Bruton Organic Dairy and ale from the Milk Street Brewery in Frome. The cheese is aged for no more than four weeks, during which time it is hand-washed in ale. This technique originated in the Franciscan monasteries of France and Belgium, adding a touch of history and tradition to this renegade cheese.

smell_taste.text: The unique combination of milk, ale, and aging process gives Renegade Monk a distinct smell and taste. The cheese has a pungent aroma, with hints of ale and a slight goaty tang. The taste is complex, with a creamy and mild interior and a stronger, more robust flavor near the rind. The cheese can be enjoyed at different stages of maturity, offering a range of flavors and textures.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, Renegade Monk should be served at room temperature. The cheese can be presented on a cheese board, with the rind intact for a visually appealing display. It pairs well with a variety of foods, such as crusty bread, crackers, and fruit. For a perfect combination, serve with a glass of red wine, such as a bold Cabernet Sauvignon or a fruity Pinot Noir.

quality_assurance.text: Renegade Monk has received high praise and recognition in the cheese world. It has been quoted as a "daring and delicious" cheese by cheese experts and has won multiple awards for its unique flavor and quality. The cheese also undergoes rigorous quality tests to ensure it meets the highest standards. With Renegade Monk, you can be assured of a cheese that is not only bold and flavorful, but also of the highest quality.

identification.text: Introducing Chevington Cheese, a deliciously unique creation from the Northumberland Cheese Company. With a rich history dating back to 1895, this cheese was first produced by Mr John W Annett in the small village of Chevington in Northumberland. After a brief hiatus, it was revived in 2001 by Marc Robertson, who discovered the original recipe and brought it back to life. For a taste of wild Northumbrian history, look no further than Chevington Cheese.

description.text: This smooth and creamy cheese is made using pasteurised Jersey Cows' Milk from local herds at Wheelbirk's Farm in Corbridge, Northumberland. It is coated with a mould-ripened layer, giving it a sharp, clean bite followed by a gentle richness. Weighing in at various sizes, Chevington is available to suit all cheese lovers. It is also suitable for vegetarians, as it is made with vegetarian rennet.

slots.CheeseProductTaste: sharp, clean bite followed by a gentle richness

process.text: At the Northumberland Cheese Company, we take great care in preparing and aging our Chevington Cheese. The original recipe from Mr Annett is followed closely, ensuring the same delicious taste that has been enjoyed for over a century. The cheese is then aged to perfection, allowing the flavours to develop and mature.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of Chevington Cheese is irresistible, with a hint of earthiness and a touch of sweetness. Upon tasting, you will be greeted with a smooth and creamy texture, followed by a sharp, clean bite that leads to a gentle richness. The taste is reminiscent of a hard English brie, making it an easy cheese to love.

slots.TasteQuality: smooth, creamy, sharp, clean, gentle, rich
slots.TasteQualityList: smooth, creamy, sharp, clean, gentle, rich

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, we recommend serving Chevington Cheese at room temperature. This allows the flavours to fully develop and enhances the creamy texture. As for presentation, this cheese is a beautiful addition to any cheese board. It pairs well with crusty bread, crackers, and fresh fruit. For a complete indulgence, try it with a glass of your favourite red wine.

quality_assurance.text: Don't just take our word for it, Chevington Cheese has received numerous awards and accolades, including major prizewinners. It is also suitable for pregnant women, making it a safe and delicious choice for all. We take great pride in our cheese and ensure the highest quality through rigorous quality tests. As one satisfied customer put it, "Chevington Cheese is a true taste of Northumberland's finest."

identification.text: Introducing Hadrian cheese, a creamy and fresh-tasting cow's milk cheese made by the renowned manufacturer Coquetdale. Named after the famous wall in Northumberland, this cheese is a tribute to its historical and geographical provenance.

description.text: Hadrian cheese is a unique and flavorful cheese that stands out with its addition of caraway seeds, traditionally used in Gouda cheese from Holland. It comes in various sizes, making it perfect for any occasion. The texture is smooth and creamy, with a delicate coating that adds to its visual appeal. Made from pasteurized cow's milk and vegetarian rennet, this cheese is suitable for all dietary preferences.

slots.CheeseProductIngredients: Cow's milk, vegetarian rennet, caraway seeds

process.text: Crafted with care, Hadrian cheese follows the Coquetdale recipe and is aged to perfection. The cheese-making process involves adding caraway seeds to the creamy cow's milk cheese, giving it a distinctive and aromatic taste. It is then aged to enhance its flavors and achieve the perfect balance of taste and texture.

identification.text: Miss Muffet, a unique cheese created by a skilled cheese maker in a continental style. This cheese has historical roots and is made in a specific geographical location.

description.text: Miss Muffet is a washed curd cheese with a supple texture and nutty creamy flavor. It has a distinct pink/grey natural mold rind, which is a result of the maturing process. The cheese weighs between 4-6 weeks and is made from pasteurized cow's milk, using vegetable rennet.

process.text: Miss Muffet is made by washing the curd pieces with warm water, removing excess whey and creating a unique flavor profile. The cheese is then aged for 4-6 weeks, allowing it to develop a sweet flavor and a supple texture.

smell_taste.text: Miss Muffet has a delightful aroma and a nutty, creamy flavor. The thorough washing of the curd results in a cheese with low acidity, making it a perfect choice for those who prefer a milder taste.

identification.text:
Godminster's Organic Brie
Godminster's Organic Brie is a delicious and high-quality cheese made by skilled artisan cheesemakers Malcolm and Steve Dyer in the beautiful market town of Bruton, Somerset. This cheese is made with fresh organic milk from Godminster Farm, which is located only one mile away from the dairy. With a rich history and a strong geographical provenance, Godminster's Organic Brie is a true testament to the traditional methods of cheese-making.

description.text: Godminster's Organic Brie is a round-shaped cheese with a creamy and smooth texture. It weighs approximately 250 grams and is coated with a thin layer of white mold. This cheese is made with organic cow's milk and uses traditional rennet, giving it a unique and authentic flavor.

process.text: The process of creating Godminster's Organic Brie is a labor of love that takes seven days from start to finish. The milk is collected from Godminster Farm and the cheese is manufactured on the same day, ensuring the freshest possible ingredients. The cheese is then drained overnight, transferred to a drying room for 24 hours, and then placed in ripening rooms for six days. Finally, it is wrapped by hand on the seventh day, ready for sale.

smell_taste.text: Godminster's Organic Brie has a distinct and inviting smell, with hints of earthy and nutty notes. When at its full maturity, the cheese has a smooth and creamy texture with a rich and buttery taste. As it ages, it becomes more crumbly and tangy, offering a different but equally delicious experience.

slots.TasteQualityList: Smooth, creamy, rich, buttery, crumbly, tangy

service_suggestions.text: To fully enjoy Godminster's Organic Brie, it is best served at room temperature. It can be presented on a cheese board with crackers, fruits, and nuts for a perfect appetizer or dessert. This cheese pairs well with a variety of foods, including apples, pears, and figs. For a complete culinary experience, it is recommended to pair Godminster's Organic Brie with a glass of dry white wine, such as a Sauvignon Blanc or Chardonnay.

slots.ComplementaryWines: dry white wine, Sauvignon Blanc, Chardonnay

quality_assurance.text: Godminster's Organic Brie has received numerous accolades and awards, including the prestigious Great Taste Award. It has also been praised by food critics and customers alike, earning rave reviews for its exceptional taste and quality. Additionally, this cheese undergoes strict quality tests to ensure that every bite is as delicious as the last. As one happy customer said, "Godminster's Organic Brie is simply the best cheese I have ever tasted."

This cheese is a result of a revolutionary collaboration between Cabot Creamery and Cellars at Jasper Hill, where it has become the cornerstone of their collection.

description.text: This approachable but complex natural-rind, bandaged cheddar is aged for 9-14 months in a specially calibrated vault in the Cellars at Jasper Hill. It is coated in lard and an additional layer of cloth, giving it a crumbly texture and nutty aroma. Made from pasteurized cow milk and using traditional rennet, this 32-pound wheel is a true artisanal cheese.

process.text: After being aged for over a decade, the young cheese is carefully coated and ripened in the Cellars at Jasper Hill, where it is constantly brushed, turned, and monitored for quality. This meticulous process results in a savory and slightly tangy flavor with a caramel sweetness to the finish.

smell_taste.text: Cabot Clothbound Cheddar has a signature tang and caramel nuttiness with a rustic crystalline texture that becomes creamy on the palate. Its deeply savory flavor makes it a standout cheese, perfect for any cheese lover.

description.text: Harbison is a 9-ounce wheel of soft-ripened cheese with a rustic, bloomy rind. It is wrapped in strips of spruce cambium, harvested from the woodlands of Jasper Hill. Made from pasteurized cow milk and aged 6-13 weeks, this cheese has a spoonable texture that softens even more on its way to market.

process.text: Harbison is prepared and aged in Jasper Hill's vaults, where it develops its unique woodsy and sweet flavors. The cheese is then wrapped in strips of spruce cambium, which adds to its distinctive taste and appearance.

smell_taste.text: Harbison has a woodsy and sweet aroma, with hints of lemon, mustard, and vegetal flavors. Its paste is soft and creamy, with a balanced and complex taste.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, gather some friends and indulge in this decadent cheese. When younger, the bark can be peeled away for easy slicing. identification.text:
Weybridge by Scholten Family Farm
Weybridge is a delicious cheese crafted by Patty and Roger Scholten on their family farm in Weybridge, Vermont. This cheese is a true labor of love, as the Scholtens manage a herd of Dutch Belt cows to produce the high-quality milk that goes into making Weybridge. The rolling landscape of Weybridge, VT serves as the perfect backdrop for this exceptional cheese.

description.text:
A Delicate and Creamy Organic Cheese
Weybridge is a lactic-set cheese with a delicate bloomy rind. Each 4-ounce wheel is expertly crafted using organic, pasteurized cow milk and a traditional lactic-set process. The result is a cheese with a creamy and rich texture, surrounded by a thin rind that adds a subtle hint of mushroom and toasty flavors.

process.text:
Traditional and Carefully Aged
The Scholtens take great care in preparing and aging their Weybridge cheese. Each wheel is carefully crafted using traditional techniques and aged for 4-8 weeks. This allows the cheese to develop its unique flavor profile and ensures that every bite is a true delight.

smell_taste.text:
A Perfect Balance of Flavors
Weybridge boasts a delightful aroma of fresh milk with hints of earthy mushrooms. The taste is a perfect balance of bright acidity and rich creaminess, showcasing the complex flavors of the Dutch Belt milk. The delicate cream-line adds a touch of sweetness to the dense, milky core.

slots.TasteQualityList: Bright acidity, rich creaminess, complex flavors

service_suggestions.text:
Versatile and Delicious
Weybridge is a versatile cheese that can be enjoyed in various ways. For a simple yet satisfying snack, pair it with freshly-baked bread and berry preserves. For a more elegant presentation, serve it as a garnish on a cheese platter. Weybridge also pairs beautifully with dry white wine, sparkling apple cider, or a crisp German pilsner.

identification.text:
A Delicious British Cheese
Shropshire Blue, made by renowned Stilton makers Cropwell Bishop, is a cheese with a rich history and a unique geographical provenance. Despite its name, this cheese is not made in Shropshire, but rather in the Stilton producing regions of Nottinghamshire, Leicestershire, and Derbyshire. Originally made in Scotland, this cheese has become a beloved British delicacy.

slots.ManufacturePlace: Stilton producing regions of Nottinghamshire, Leicestershire, and Derbyshire
slots.CheeseCreatorMovedToPlace: Stilton producing regions of Nottinghamshire, Leicestershire, and Derbyshire

description.text:
2) A Cheese with Distinct Characteristics
Shropshire Blue is a visually stunning cheese with its vibrant orange hue, thanks to the addition of natural dye annatto. Its texture is firm, making it perfect for slicing and melting. This cheese is made from pasteurized cow's milk and uses vegetarian rennet, making it suitable for vegetarians. Each piece weighs 250g, making it an ideal size for sharing.

process.text:
The Preparation and Aging Process
The cheesemaking process of Shropshire Blue is a true pleasure to behold. The evening and morning milk are combined before adding the starter culture, rennet, and penicillium roqueforti, which gives the cheese its distinctive blue veining. After the curds form, they are drained, milled, and salted before being hand-ladled into their molds. The cheese is then aged for a total of 5 weeks, allowing the blue veining to develop and the flavors to mature.

smell_taste.text:
4) Aroma and Flavor That Will Delight Your Senses
Shropshire Blue has a bold and tangy flavor, similar to that of a Stilton, but with a unique twist. The addition of annatto gives this cheese a slightly nutty and sweet flavor, making it stand out from other blue cheeses. Its aroma is equally enticing, with a rich and earthy scent that will awaken your taste buds.

service_suggestions.text:
Serving Suggestions
Shropshire Blue is a versatile cheese that can be enjoyed in many ways. For a simple and elegant presentation, serve it on a cheese board at room temperature. For a more indulgent experience, try it in a toasted sandwich with roasted sweet peppers and caramelized walnuts. This cheese also pairs well with honey, macadamia nuts, and a port dressing in a salad. For the perfect accompaniment, enjoy it with a glass of full-bodied red wine.

service_suggestions.text: For the best experience, serve Eve at room temperature to allow the flavors to fully develop. Its beautiful appearance makes it a great addition to any cheeseboard. Pair it with crackers, fruits, and nuts for a perfect snack. For a more indulgent experience, pair it with a glass of white wine, such as a Sauvignon Blanc.

quality_assurance.text: Eve has received high praise from cheese connoisseurs, with quotations describing it as "heavenly" and "wonderful". It has also won numerous awards, solidifying its position as a top-quality cheese. Rest assured, each bite of Eve is a testament to its exceptional quality.

identification.text: Gorwydd Caerphilly is a premium cheese made by Trethowan's Dairy in North Somerset, United Kingdom. With its origins dating back to the town of Caerphilly in Wales, this cheese has a rich historical and geographical provenance that adds to its unique flavor and character.

description.text: This cheese is a medium-sized wheel, weighing in at 250g. Its signature shape and size, along with its creamy and slightly springy texture, make it a standout among other cheeses. Made with unpasteurized cow's milk and traditional rennet, Gorwydd Caerphilly boasts of high-quality ingredients that contribute to its exceptional taste.

process.text: Gorwydd Caerphilly is prepared using traditional methods and aged for a minimum of 2 months. This careful process ensures that the cheese develops its distinct flavor and texture, making it a true artisanal product.

smell_taste.text: The aroma of Gorwydd Caerphilly is fresh and clean, with notes of lemon that add a subtle tanginess to its flavor. The taste is rich and creamy, with a perfect balance of tanginess and sweetness that lingers on the palate.

service_suggestions.text: To fully enjoy the flavors of Gorwydd Caerphilly, it is best served at room temperature. It can be presented on a cheese board with simple crackers, or used in a variety of dishes. We recommend trying it in a toastie with roasted leeks and English mustard for a delicious twist. This cheese also pairs well with a crisp white wine or a full-bodied red.
